reviews.text: A bit of a touristy winery. There are definitely classier ones around for wine tasting. However the chocolate wine pairing is awesome. The cheese wine pairing also good. Forget the biltong one. Good for travel bored 18 year olds !
Very nice for relaxation. Friendly staff and good wine. Will definitely recommend the winery to anyone!

What a disappointment this was ! The beautiful views sadly were the best thing about this place. We had the three course pairing menu which the waitress told us we could order 2 dishes from the starter section and a main course if we wanted and that is what I did. Imagine my surprise when my two starters arrived at the same time. The seared salmon and duck, with a glass of red and wine wine. Both of which were bland and boring. The main course (the pork) was marginally better but not much. The wine pairing is a joke, they just serve one of their own wines with the food. It in no way actually went along or enhanced the food. I have had fantastic pairing meals at other places that really make an effort to match the wine to the food (or the other way around). Considering the price of this meal, it was most disappointing. The food was just not up to standard.

Horrible experience. Waited at the door just to be ignored by all the staff they were not busy. Desided to make our own way to the restaurant just to rudely informed that they were in between servings and they couldn't help us. They didn't ask if we would like to wait or enjoy a glass of wine...I wouldn't even like to buy their wine in the future. 
Rather visit Klein Roosboom across the road.
Excellent food and service. The wine pairing was spot on. Especially with the dessert. Was the second time I've been there and would go again.

ChIJO1mizFeozR0RXT7d_wA5J7M.adr_address: Taillefer & Main Road, Southern Paarl, Paarl, 7646, South Africa

reviews.text: Ok. No wine tasting or sales. No kids menu. Small climbing frame. Nice terrace. Great fillet and carpaccio. My son thought the pizza was â€˜spectacularâ€™.

The four settings from which you can choose:
1) Wine tasting shaded beneath magnificent overhanging ðŸŒ²'s
2) Wine tasting inside the elegant Cape Dutch wine tasting room
3 +4) Lunch at two different restaurants on-site, each overlooking their own expanse of vinyards
Very nice wine tasting with Gert and great lunch at The Paarlrock terrace. Superb oxtail.

We were very excited to take friends from Joburg to Laborie for the MCC and Macaron pairing, as listed on the website. Upon arrival we were greeted with very friendly staff, however we were notified that they donâ€™t offer any pairings anymore. Overall a good experience, however I would suggest updating your website so that expectations can be met.
Knowledge th waiter very good .food lamb shank very good the restaurant inside.needs soft furnishings plants maybe to give atmosphere and candles .

reviews.text: Stunning venue. Excellent food at De Werf and beautiful green surroundings. Perfect for a day outing and picnics.
Le picnique. Delightful was to relax. Stunning hamper for two with everything one would need. Blankets, beanbags and back rests provided. Staff are amazing too.
Lovely picnic on the lawn, under the trees. Good picnic hamper, nice variaty.
Good food, great atmosphere in a beautifull setting.The perfect picnic!
Beautiful place for an out of town picnic. Loved it.

ChIJqZ4XAcKvzR0Rhr9E7o4fXDc.vicinity: Boschendal Estate, Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franschhoek

ChIJuxNWYrxXzB0RHyPFwu6bd7Y.name: Diemersdal Wine Estate

reviews.text: Decent wine. We tried to buy a meet platter at the restaurant thatâ€™s 20M away but they where not very cooperative. Didnâ€™t seem to be interested in selling anything. When we did the wine tasting they were very slow with giving us the next one so we ended up going back and forth to the bar every time. Very pretty place but they could put a little more effort in to it.
Awesome wines, lovely venue. Outside seating area is a bit small but a great place to sit on a warm sunny day. Inside is unmemorable.

The setting outside is intimate enough for a romantic Saturday or Sunday picnic. Luscious green lawns for the kids to run around and explore and the food is mouthwatering and the delectable wine selection will smooth even the most sophisticated pallets.
Set in the tranquil Durbanville winelands it's really worth a visit. Ample parking wit wheelchair access to the restaurant.
Great service and top notch meals! For sure worth a visit, it's a lovely venue!
Lovely food and wonderful service. We had the "tapas menu" and were very impressed. Restaurant is in a lovely setting in an old farm building. Very enjoyable.

ChIJ80Fzhx6vzR0RjOEqya7KzKs.adr_address: Intersection R45 and Simondium-Klapmuts Roads, Franschhoek Wine Route, Simondium, 7670, South Africa
ChIJ80Fzhx6vzR0RjOEqya7KzKs.formatted_address: Intersection R45 and Simondium-Klapmuts Roads, Franschhoek Wine Route, Simondium, 7670, South Africa
ChIJ80Fzhx6vzR0RjOEqya7KzKs.name: Vrede en Lust Wine Estate

reviews.text: This place just seems to get better and better! Recently renovated to maximize on the surrounding beauty and for customer comfort, this place is a must stop! Not to mention it's completely off grid with 1000-odd solar panels, all wines are in fact Vinified by the sun. Impressive! The added bonus is you can pick up top wines for everyday drinking as well as some for long term investment.

Vrede en Lust is an old historic wine farm with a dash of modern. The Lust Bistro serves Sunday buffet at R195 on the first Sunday of the month. The home baked bread they sell, looks devine. Tasty wine. The tasting room is set within a picturesque environment. The farm makes use of solar power. A big plus. There is a electric car charging station. Wow. The first one I've seen so far.

Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful place! The wine tasting is very popular here. There is also a restaurant. This was our first stop on the Franshhoek Wine Tram and we really enjoyed ourselves here. Highly recommended!

Nice setting and atmosphere, good menu and delicious food, staff are very friendly although waiters at the bistro could be slightly more attentive. Good eco approach with all the photovoltaic panels. Nice selection of wines with knowledgeable hosts and finally a wine farm which can spell Syrah correctly! ðŸ¤—

Superb wines at very good prices. Friendly professional staff provide great service, all enclosed in a truly memorable setting.  My personal choice is the Viognier and the Cotes de Savoye world class wines

ChIJ80Fzhx6vzR0RjOEqya7KzKs.vicinity: Intersection R45 and Simondium-Klapmuts Roads, Franschhoek Wine Route, Simondium

ChIJ1Xz4g1hTzB0RR541YHuhofg.adr_address: Cnr R304 & R101 Koelenhof, Stellenbosch, 7530, South Africa
ChIJ1Xz4g1hTzB0RR541YHuhofg.formatted_address: Cnr R304 & R101 Koelenhof, Stellenbosch, 7530, South Africa
ChIJ1Xz4g1hTzB0RR541YHuhofg.name: Villiera Wines

reviews.text: Wonderful game drive to see wild animals so close. Excellent service as well in the tasting room

Upon arrival we were welcomed very warmly by the staff of Villiera Wines. They were very helpful with their explanation.
We took the game drive tour (a 2 hour safari tour through the lands surrounding the winefarm).
The guide was very professional and had alot of knowledge. We stopped from time to time while coming across zebras, giraffes, antilopes, turtles, eagles, etc...
Everytime we got interesting information concerning the animals.
After the tour we did the winetasting. Again very professionaly done and even turned out to be free (we did buy 3 bottles of wine eventually).
Would definitely recommend.
The environment is perfect and we enjoyed our wine so much
Tranquil, modern tasting room with old school charm. A variety of wines to taste, we enjoyed the MCC's.
Every wine is absolutely Devine!

Overall a great experience. We had s picnic basket under the trees. Although it was a very hot day, it really cool and pleasant under the trees. We also had a wine tasting which added to the experience. The basket of goodies supplied had some great meats and pate selections whilst some of the other preserves and deserts were not so great.

Beautiful venue and great picnic pod. Scrumptious picnic hamper. Possibly enough for three. Could do with a bit more bread though considering conditments and savouries.  Suitable wine offer at reasonable prices. Service level acceptable to good. Suitable for families with kiddies or not.

We spent the whole day at Warwick. Truly a beautiful  experience. The kids loved it. They were running around playing in the water fountains and climbing on the playground. Two notes: If you come with little children better get a table / blanket down by the water. Close to the playground there are plenty of bees. Thankfully they are there pollinating and keeping the plants busy for the lovely ðŸ·, but having to watch every bite your child takes is nerve-wracking. The 2nd note is that the packaging of the food (currently paper and plastic for some) could be better, maybe glass containers with screw on lids, porcelain or even reusable plastic would be great and help also with the ðŸ. 4/5 due to the packaging, highly recommended with little children!
What a lovely place. Vibe is excellent, food is good. Kid friendly and we loved the picnic. Will definitely recommend this venue for a day out with friends and family.

Fantastic venue for a staff party! We had a wonderful day at such a relaxing place Friendly and very helpful staff. The picnic baskets are out of this world What a tasty meal We will return. Thanks Warwick

ChIJezjaVvNNzB0RfNLvlumxjjI.adr_address: Stellenbosch Kloof Road, Vlottenberg, Stellenbosch, 7604, South Africa
ChIJezjaVvNNzB0RfNLvlumxjjI.formatted_address: Stellenbosch Kloof Road, Vlottenberg, Stellenbosch, 7604, South Africa
ChIJezjaVvNNzB0RfNLvlumxjjI.name: Jordan Wine Estate

reviews.text: Beautiful spot but why must most wine farms have such slow service? Would be perfect otherwise

The position and atmosphere is tranquil and with beautiful surroundings of the stellenbosch vineyards and mountains. The meals are equisetely prepared and presented. The waiters are pleasant and helpful. Would definitely go again.
Very pleasant stop on the wine route. Lovely bakery & good service received.
Good wine. The restaurant is fantastic. If you like fine dining this is the place to visit in stellenbosch.
Extremly friendly personnel, stunning view and a delicious lunch. I will be back!

ChIJ129hMOeszR0RUhcgNrQGlZM.adr_address: Fischers Road, Stellenbosch Farms, Stellenbosch, 7579, South Africa
ChIJ129hMOeszR0RUhcgNrQGlZM.formatted_address: Fischers Road, Stellenbosch Farms, Stellenbosch, 7579, South Africa
ChIJ129hMOeszR0RUhcgNrQGlZM.name: Goede Hoop Wine Estate

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time with Johan, the son of the owner, that spend the whole afternoon explaining us the history of the farm and the region. It was a true wine tasting experience and not some commercial fake touristy experience. Thanks for that Johan!
Excellent wines

Hierdie wynmaker is dalk nie so algemeen bekend nie, maar lewer van die beste wyne waarmee ons al te doen gehad het. Ons het ook al in opvolgende oesjare Goede Hoop probeer en bly die wyne uitstekend so asof elke jaar 'n goeie oesjaar was. Die wymaker het duidelik in-diepte kennis van die fyner kuns van wynmaak en sorg deurgaans vir aangename wyne wat weer en weer gekoop kan word. Die Merlot is veral uitstekend.

ChIJkRI7hCWyzR0R-hs6Dd6d5os.adr_address: 1 Lanzerac Rd, Jonkershoek, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJkRI7hCWyzR0R-hs6Dd6d5os.formatted_address: 1 Lanzerac Rd, Jonkershoek, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJkRI7hCWyzR0R-hs6Dd6d5os.name: Lanzerac Wine Estate

reviews.text: Wooooow mind blowing experience. Will sure be going back... had most memorable time.  Excellent staff and customer care
Beautiful place very quiet friendly staff excellent service come nd see urself u feel weLume at the lanzerac hotel
5-Star. Had a fire in 2017 so busy  with exciting renovations
Wonderfull rememberance of wedding 37 years ago

Wonderful atmosphere and scenery and a beautiful setting. A brilliant wine selection with excellent house wines.
Food is also good with my only complaint being that the burgers should be ordered a level more rare than you would normally order since they seem to be left on the heat a little too long.

ChIJja3wS9mszR0RHZFuwaEKgRY.adr_address: Kromme Rhee Rd, Stellenbosch, Cape Town, 7605, South Africa
ChIJja3wS9mszR0RHZFuwaEKgRY.formatted_address: Kromme Rhee Rd, Stellenbosch, Cape Town, 7605, South Africa
ChIJja3wS9mszR0RHZFuwaEKgRY.name: Simonsig Wine Estate

reviews.text: What a great place. Very generous with the amounts of wine during the tasting. Great staff with a lot of knowledge. Lovely wines. Very rich in flavor, more like the traditional french wines, so it must be your thing.

Arrived at the Wine Estate and was greeted with a smile. Had the most awesome day there. The guy who helped us were professional and friendly. He also explained each wine every time. I would really go there again and again.

Nice wine. Not my favorites but they have a very large selection that you can choose from. Beautiful view but the steak for lunch was absolutely fantastic. My knife just fell through the meat it was so tender.
Excellent wines! Nice place also for children.  Good restaurant and very good service.
Great eating experience. Expensive but well worth it. Highly recommended.

ChIJja3wS9mszR0RHZFuwaEKgRY.vicinity: Kromme Rhee Road, Stellenbosch, Cape Town

ChIJDcvt0Z-pzR0RB8C1fxZNr8s.adr_address: Suid-Agter-Paarl Rd, Suider-Paarl, 7646, South Africa
ChIJDcvt0Z-pzR0RB8C1fxZNr8s.name: Fairview Wine and Cheese

reviews.text: Just love the natural beauty of this place. Eye candy everywhere. The wine tasting with cheese pairing was divine, and very informative. Found a new favorite wine as well. Very friendly staff as well. A must, before heading over to CBC for beer tasting.

It has absolutely beautiful gardens and views. The wine tasting however, was overcrowded and the cheese looked like it had been in the open for too long. I recommend going for a wine and cheese tasting just before tourist season so it isn't too hot or too full. The wine is great. I recommend this place.

Enjoy the beautiful rural environment and feel, the inspiring and peaceful scenery, good selection of cheese and wine, well positioned restaurant and altogether healthy change of pace in your heart and mind. The variety of fresh bread, cheese and jams on sale are highly recommended and can easily become a scrumptious family meal.

What an awesome experience.  Friendly staff. An immense array of cheeses and olive oil to die for. We ate very well in a beautiful cool setting under trees. I did find the chairs to be very uncomfortable. I highly recommend this place.

Delicious farm breakfast, cheese and wines! This is the perfect spot for a day out with family and friends. I love how the owners have made a big area for the goats to enjoy. Perfect on a sunny or rainy day.

ChIJz7smy7WtzR0RNVd0R7el4Ms.adr_address: Knorhoek Road, Koelenhof, Stellenbosch, South Africa
ChIJz7smy7WtzR0RNVd0R7el4Ms.formatted_address: Knorhoek Road, Koelenhof, Stellenbosch, South Africa
ChIJz7smy7WtzR0RNVd0R7el4Ms.name: Muratie Wine Estate

reviews.text: Always a good spot. I did a quick stop to grab some wine for Christmas presents. As always they're friendly and very helpful.

Cozy little vineyard. A fantastic place to hang around and sip a glass of wine!
With little tourists.
Muratie dates back from the time of Simon van der Stel. It is a beautiful wine farm with a good restaurant and a taste room with world-renowned cobwebs.

Beautiful old wine estate. The wines are delicious and the staff is very friendly. Claudia told us all we wanted to know about the wines and the wineyard. Also she explained us how we can order wine via the Capreo System when we are back in Germany which is a really easy and cheap way to order some of your favorite bottles from Muratie and many different other wineries within the Capreo in case you cannot take all of them with you. Also Claudia talks very good German too. The Garden outside is beautiful and there you can sit and enjoy wine and some delicious food (we had a cheese platter with a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc). Absolutely fantastic experience, not too crowded, not too posh and down to earth, lovely staff and excellent quality of wines and food. Absolutely recommendable!
Excellent wine tasting with very nice stories on every wine. Absolute must go. Very good wines also.

ChIJ8dg2GQZqzB0RdaskDQc6xoQ.adr_address: Steenberg Rd, Tokai, Cape Town, 7945, South Africa
ChIJ8dg2GQZqzB0RdaskDQc6xoQ.formatted_address: Steenberg Rd, Tokai, Cape Town, 7945, South Africa
ChIJ8dg2GQZqzB0RdaskDQc6xoQ.name: Steenberg Vineyards

reviews.text: They very nice wine tasting area and 1682 bistro light meal menu is very gd.

Cape Town southern suburbs are not exactly known for great wine farms, so imagine my surprise when I visited this majestically beautiful place to see for my upcoming wedding.

To say that this place is beautiful is an understatement. The hotel is beautifully designed, modern, but with a hint of colonial. The restaurant is modern, open plan and very accommodating and helpful with regards to our requests for our dinner.

We did some wine tasting, which is located on the premises, yet somehow a separate entity frm the hotel and restaurant. The design of the distillery and accompanying restaurant is modern, chic and VERY impressive. The wines in their Platinum range are REALLY good, sweet, bold and a great finish. 

I cannot wait to spend  my great event at this venue! HIGHLY recommended!!!

Fantastic place for food and relaxing.
Very polite and competent waiters. And even fair prices. Go there, enjoy your dishes and the nice view.
Tapas concept with local ingredients works so well! Delicious menu makes it a challenge to limit choice and the setting is amazing.

Fantastic place with an interesting history, great wines and very fair prizes for the wine tasting as well as dinner. Service could have been a bit more friendly, and there seems to be 'a situation' between the wine-tasting and the restaurant. However, still 5 starts for the magical place!

ChIJPwwprfW8zR0RrtBhy6raMVU.adr_address: 40 Uitkyk St, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJPwwprfW8zR0RrtBhy6raMVU.name: Chamonix Wine Farm

reviews.text: A brilliant wine farm, host and vibe! The Chardonnay and Point Noir are an absolute must!
Their tasting room isnâ€™t half as fancy as others in the area - but if itâ€™s award winning world class wine youâ€™re after, then this is the place.
New Year's Eve 2017 was well catered for with  good food, DJ and Kaapse Klopse.
Magnificent people. Great experience. Do there.

Quite esquisite and comfortable place. Everyone was very friendly and The food was divine.
We didn't stayed at the place or did The Wine tour (since we already did several of these tours), we chose to only stay at the restaurant and Enjoy the place.
Everything was excelent. 

The menu offered just 4 options of main courses, but what it seems to lack in variety, it really compensates on the quality. There's also a vegetarian options which in no way falls behind the meats.

Desserts are well harmonized and The coffe has its grains grinded almost in front of you.

We ordered two wines, The first one we tried to chose and The second one we ask for a recommendation (The first was good, but be should have listened The staff from de begining - hahahaha).

In the end, a lunch with 2 good wines, 2 entres, 3 main courses, 2 desserts and 1 espresso was around 500 rand (tip included).
Totally worth it.

reviews.text: What a 5 star place: rolling lawns, catering services, pool - an oasis in the middle of nowhere. Calm, relaxing environment

It was really great attending the South African Medical-Legal Mediation Training there in July 2016 with my friend and colleague from the Department of Philosophy at the University of Stellenbosch. The ambiance, the decor, the courtesy, the food, and the wine were all splendid. I highly and unreservedly recommend the Nelson Wine Estate for any guests as groups, couples, or individuals.
A lovely place to host an event...ðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘Œ
Accommodation was terrible. No toilet paper, cold water tap didn't work. Shower barely worked. 2 saucers, 2 teaspoons, only 1 cup. Worst complimentary muffin I've ever tasted.

Not a great experience, whatsoever:
 
A fun wedding â€“BUT:
- Unfriendly staff
- Unprofessional staff (bunch of kids behind the bar)
- Unprofessional owner, who verbally attacked my partner when they disagreed whether the wine was faulty or not
- No reply to the email I send over 2 weeks ago prior to this post, highlighting the events of that evenings
- No credit card or withdrawal facilities
- Dirty Guest room â€“ especially for the price
- No napkins on the tables â€“ not even paper napkins, at a wedding
- Not impressed â€“ especially since I have not heard back from them after my email either...

reviews.text: We were Superbly looked after. The picnic was an exciting treasure trove of delectable delights. The white wine was refreshing and crisp , ideal for a hot day. The kids were kept entertained and satisfied. All in all a truly memorable experience, we'll be back! Soon!

Been here a few times, twice for my wife's birthday. Beautiful wine farm, amazing place to have a relaxing picnic under the trees. Picnic baskets available are delicious and very filling! The wine is absolutely amazing as well!
Amazing wine tasting venue with really great wine and simple snack platters. Friendly and knowledgeable staff.
Perfect wine ,food and even picnic

Beautiful venue with excellent service, a regular haunt for lunch. Never had the picnic lunch previously and it proved to be very disappointing. Will return to Hartenberg again but will definitely not have the picnic lunch. Still a great experience love the venue and staff.

ChIJZa8zj9yvzR0RE9Yspe-GKGQ.adr_address: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franchhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJZa8zj9yvzR0RE9Yspe-GKGQ.formatted_address: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franchhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJZa8zj9yvzR0RE9Yspe-GKGQ.name: Boschendal Wine Estate

reviews.text:
Hawaii and California has a baby and it is called Boschendal!! We love sitting under a MASSIVE tree and sipping some pretty good wine. We experimented a little on what they had to offered and we found some new flavors that we didnâ€™t know we liked!! The Riesling is dry - too dry for my taste but my husband liked it. The S&M was my favorite. The staff was attentive without being pushy or overbearing. 

We ended up buying the brandy.

Our Cape Town host brought us here especially and we are glad she did. A very beautiful and picturesque winery/garden. After visiting a few other wineries, it was very pleasant to spend some time walking around the grounds and enjoying the atmosphere.

After exploring, we settled in for some decadent chocolates and another fine set of wine tasting. I particularly enjoyed the Brandy and sparkling wine options.
Nthando was fantastic. Great wine tasting. Good views of the mountains and good wine

The property is really pretty. Wine estates usually are. It was so hot, and such a lovely day under the trees at the restaurant. The food was interesting. I think I expected more of it when the waitress told me I couldn't get a burger for my child because this was fine dinning. When the food arrived it was just ok. The slow cooked lamb wasn't falling off anything... quite tough actually. The other food was also, just ok. Nothing new or groundbreaking. Well seasoned and what not, just not WOW. The wine selection is excellent though, all your favourite hues are on offer. No actual kiddies meals, so if you can, don't take them to the restaurant. We were at WERF. Perhaps the other restaurant has a better selection of kiddies meals,but we didn't go there. A picnic in the open area will be better if you're with the kids. All in all, great pictures to be taken, great views, great wine.
Beautiful, relaxing and calm atmosphere.. And great staff super friendly and helpful!

ChIJZa8zj9yvzR0RE9Yspe-GKGQ.vicinity: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franchhoek

ChIJEVLz_2yyzR0RVZ5iKIiMmGA.adr_address: Ida's Valley, Lelie St, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa

ChIJEVLz_2yyzR0RVZ5iKIiMmGA.name: Glenelly Estate

reviews.text: Try the Lady May, a true experience sitting on the balcony overlooking the vineyards. The friendliest service makes this a must visit. When there pop into the gallery as well. Exceptional glass pieces.
The best meal in the greatest ambiance in 2017 for me.  A great little secret

Great wine sales knowledge and tact, no mention of paying for the tasting prior to being introduced to the wines and being offered mineral water gratis. The vine restaurant looks perfect for a medium sized gathering. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Paved drive to the tasting rooms. Clean and well maintained facilties. Beautiful vistas of the surrounds. Can recommend the Lady May wine!
Loved this winery - amazing wines, beautiful tasting room & friendly staff!
Great wines and views. One of my absolute favorite wine farms

ChIJfYoifVqszR0RzuyPJbSksKw.adr_address: R44, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJfYoifVqszR0RzuyPJbSksKw.name: Uitkyk Wine Estate

reviews.text: Nice place. Good wine. Indoor and outdoor seatings. Very good staff.

The wines are fantastic and so is the setting but the staff do the wine tasting centre a disservice. If you visit on a Sunday, make sure you order your wine tasting by 15:29 because apparently the tastings stop at 15:30 and there are "wine sales" until 16:00. 

Begrudgingly we were allowed to taste at 15:40 but I'm not sure Speed Wine Tasting is a   passtime that will go mainstream. Such a shame because the first two times I came here we thoroughly enjoyed it.
Lovely romantic venue with the most beautiful view. The wine isn't too bad either.
Awesome little gem. Both brandy and wine tasting. Brilliant service on a beautiful estate.
Great venue for open air cinema!

ChIJhfdWtrRZzB0RvrBvF0enYwA.adr_address: Cape Farms, Cape Town, South Africa

ChIJhfdWtrRZzB0RvrBvF0enYwA.name: Hillcrest Estate

reviews.text: Restaurant is really nice with beautiful views down the valley to the sea. Both breakfast and lunch was very good. I particularly enjoyed the burger. Parents - there is no specific play area. But for older kids there is a grass outdoor section they can run around on.
Me outdoor beer and wine garden is great, beer and pizzas were very good. Nice to mix in to your MTB ride

Worst pizza ever. So dry it could double for frisby. Got served by barman, as there are no waiters, which told us there are actually two restaurants after we sat down? Should there not be someone to greet us at entrance to explain that?
We both went to the toilet about 4 times after!!!

Took my wife for breakfast on her birthday - very disappointed. Small breakfast menu & overpriced. Ordered the pancake breakfast and got served last weeks pancakes. Very stale and brittle, could not cut it, complained to manager who offered to tell the chef, and did not charge us for the 1 breakfast. Will not be going back, disappointing, as it was one of our favorite places for breakfast.
Overpriced food and drinks. Service abysmal. Setting is nice..woo friggin hoo

ChIJteN-m46vzR0Rs2Tx2gNjzXc.adr_address: Delta Road & R45, Drakenstein, Franschhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJteN-m46vzR0Rs2Tx2gNjzXc.formatted_address: Delta Road & R45, Drakenstein, Franschhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJteN-m46vzR0Rs2Tx2gNjzXc.name: Solms Delta Wine Estate

reviews.text:
Nice winery. We arrived late in the day, just before closing time. The staff was very friendly and shared with us their story. The owner of the vineyard takes a personal interest in the lives of his staff. He invests heavily into their future and livelihood.
Try the Jazz Shiraz; I found it fun and refreshing after a day full of wines.
Amazing place. Very historical and a nice place to have a picnic. Also has amazing wine. Highly recommend
What a disappointment. Everything was cheap except the price tag. The staff were friendly and helpful but other than that I'm afraid the picnic basket was awful

Went for a picnic. An awesome picnic spot next to a river and surrounded by a beautiful forest. The tractor that shuttles guests to the picnic spots were a great hit with the kids and the heritage selection of wines is truly world class
Friendly staff, awesome picnics for families or couples. Bound to find a quiet place next to the stream.

An excellent choice for people who loves the outdoors. Walk through rows of plants and enjoy the tranquility of water. There is farm animals, from a donkey to turkeys. Do be careful of the guinea fowls because they tend to be aggressive. A guinea fowl attacked my two year old niece leaving her with a cut on her forehead. It is probably not the best place for small children as there is a bridge over a river. There are also deep squared pools of water and one area has poisonous plants. There is a bord that clearly states that no children are allowed in the area where the poisonous plants are. It is a beautiful estate with trails for the hiking enthusiasts with a maze to get lost in.

There is a restaurant with freshly prepared food. Everything is made from scratch in their kitchen with ingredients from the farm. I have to commend them for having gluten free options for the person whom cannot tolerate gluten. The only criticism from my side is that the menu can have a bigger variety to choose from. Other than that, the food was excellent and cleverly garnished.

A good mix of nature, adventure and excellent food to end your positive experience.

Probably one of our most favourite places on our trip. The gardens are gorgeous, lush and fragrant and the free-roaming animals look very happy. We had a late lunch in the greenhouse and it was a wonderful experience. The food was delicious and the service great.
The shop with homemade products is really nice and has a great, if somewhat pricey, selection of jams, biltong, cheese and more. Highly recommended!

A truly amazing wine estate with lovely gardens that you can wander through at your leisure. We had a really good lunch at the Glasshouse restaurant. Highly recommend. You can easily spend a good part of your day at this estate.

Top
This is the best farm I have ever been. You can easily enjoy a whole morning there wandering in the nice garden. Must do...

Very touristy!
R10.00 per person entrance fee to get into the farm.
Not a pleasant experience, I think booking over the tourist season is essential, since there is no place to eat or drink without a long waiting time if you do not have a booking.
Gardens is spectacular, but we nearly died of thirst!

ChIJDyjhGNWszR0RHUcJ7CDy8A0.adr_address: Bottelary Rd, Stellenbosch Farms, Stellenbosch, 7599, South Africa
ChIJDyjhGNWszR0RHUcJ7CDy8A0.formatted_address: Bottelary Rd, Stellenbosch Farms, Stellenbosch, 7599, South Africa

reviews.text: I went for a picnic at Hazendal wine estate, it was wonderful, good value for money. Wide selection of foods, great wine. An intimate setting, well informed staff regarding wine and very helpful. I would really recommend it to anyone.
Rustic and tranquil.  Delicious Ploughmans Platter.  Lovely affordable wine selection.
Best value for money..  Baskets are awesome and the wine is great..

Very nice setting. Hosted a Kiddies birthday Party there during the summer. Enough space for a jumping castle and kiddies tables. They have outdoor seating and setup for adults, and do platters. Very accommodating. Did have some guests remark on comments made by the staff which werent nice, but staff apologised.
The food is limited, the service is non existent. The fish my wife order was not deboned. And they payed more attention to the big function in the inside venue than to the Customers outside.

reviews.text: Unique wines, as Nature intended them - no chemicals in the vineyards or the cellar. Beautiful fruit, clean and delicious!
Excellent food, best ingredients. Beautiful location at Avondale wine farm.

Food was OUTSTANDING. Best we had in Cape Town. Wine equally fantastic. Waiters were well versed, helpful and very welcoming. We really enjoyed the night and would gladly return. Only unpleasant part of the evening was the tone of the restaurant manager - incredibly condescending and rude to the serving staff. It was really off-putting and sad to hear.
Great food, but too small portions
Great as always.

reviews.text:
Always great atmosphere. Super food and very friendly staff. Pitty about the patrons....at two seperate tables people sitting with feet o. The tables. One woman and one man. This is a restaurant!!!
Go do this at home!!! Not in public!!!
Enjoy crafted beer and a sumptuous sliced meat and cheese platter under the trees in a lovely garden. Wonderful lazy experience.
Lovely place, offers a large variety of wines. The tasting was great fun.
Lovely spot for wine tasting or a beer tasting combined with a cheese platter. Will be back to try the Bistro.
A stunning location. Beautiful scenery.

reviews.text: The best place on earth. The best wine. The owner is an absolute gentleman.
Small and beautiful. Friendly staff, great history behind the wine, superb vin de Constance, the whole family felt being home. Donâ€™t hesitate.
Stunning farm with absolutely amazing wines. Vin De Constance is so good!!!
Very pleasantly and friendly services. Very accommodating en some of the best wines
Beautiful wineyard. Do the low-key wine sampling & especially the Vin de Constance

reviews.text: This is the place where all started where CBD the name and the dream that I always wanted for people and for children and unique and special way of training skills sufficiency and also your best labour supporter recruiting and also investing into the future.
Beautiful outdoor area for wine tasting or dining. Lovely views. Restaurant offers good value for money.
Had our wedding here in late March was such a great day weather was perfect the food was outstanding and the staff were friendly and helpful 5/5!
Fantastic food... unbelievable relaxed vibe. Would definitely recommend a trip out of town to come chill out here.
Good food. Clean air. Relaxing atmosphere.

Brilliant mtb playground
Breathe taking experience
Great Place.
Fantastic experience

ChIJfWGVArtRzB0RFGQDAI3bw-0.name: Kaapzicht Wine Estate

reviews.text: Beautiful family run wine estate. Friendly service and amazing wines

The setting of this vineyard is spectacular and the wines were among the best I tasted while in South Africa (and I tasted quite a few!) Danie and his family were so friendly and welcoming. I'd highly recommend a trip to anyone wanting to see a real working vineyard and learn more about wine making while tasting some incredible wines...also make sure you try the port and ice wine while you're there- unique and delicious!
Ideal for wine tasting and venues. The best Hanepoot Muskadel ever tasted.

One of the most beautiful spots on the Cape, with top notch, honest wines to boot. This is a functioning wine farm, not a billionaires show home, which means you can see production from grape to glass, (if your lucky taste each stage too!) and meet the people that love their craft.

Just opened a bottle of the 2012 Steyler Pinotage which we purchased untasted, along with some other wines, what a gem. This was the first winery we visited on a month trip around Western Provence last Sep, apart from the six national parks visited the wineries of the area are a great draw card and some of the most picturesque in the world. Well after 30 plus wineries this was in the top three "my personal favourite", might not have the wow factor of some but makes up by being family owned and this comes through their wines. Back to the 2012 Pinotage "superb" must return for more "little problem we live in Australia!" Oh well better savour the next glass before the wife gets more, cheers.

reviews.text: Mooiplaas is the best farm ever to have a picnic, wine tastings, hiking trails, horse riding, and so much more on this farm. my experience i had is the friendly staff and the excellent wine!
Very nice hiking trail and very friendly and homily family
Really poor service (they were watching tv and we had to hunt for them to finish our wine tasting), overpriced, boring picnic baskets and for a wine farm, they were very reluctant to sell us wine

Beautiful scenery 
Peaceful and outstanding wine
Tranquil setting. Very beautiful.

reviews.text: Nice spot. Awesome wine. They can improve on their way  of tasting and buying. Example. ...wavering your tasting fees if you spend like over R10000 on their wines. nevertheless great wines.

A small vineyard compared to others in the valley, but with a really good choice of wine, and wonderful tasting wines. The tasting room is small too but well furnished, and with a porch facing the vineyard and the hills with an astonishing view
Very nice wines. A small place with a personal touch.
Really luv this place
Sensationeller Wein,sehr persoenliche Weinprobe,

reviews.text: The wood fired pizza was great and the wines on offer at the tasting, were really good. Nice and relaxed outside seating.
Lovely wine, best sauvignon blanc, pinotage and cinsaut! Delicious pizzas and wine pairing
Wonderful food and wine, reasonably priced. Beautiful view.
Very cosy. Great food and wine
Great wines.. yummy pizzas!!

ChIJb_fYuOqvzR0RVTymUd8-0F0.adr_address: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franshhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJb_fYuOqvzR0RVTymUd8-0F0.formatted_address: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franshhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJb_fYuOqvzR0RVTymUd8-0F0.name: Boschendal

reviews.text:
Great outdoor picnic spot. We visited the Rhone Rose Garden which is a full service picnic area. We had a lovely table under the trees with loads of lawn space for the kids to run around. Bring a ball to add to the fun.

The picnic baskets were packed to the brim filled with yummy snacks... Some a little more intense than I'm used to such as the farm style chicken liver but it was all very tasty.
5 stars all round. Amazing food. Amazing view. Amazing accommodation!
Amazing food and wine in an even more amazing setting under oak trees that date back to 1682

The setting was absolutely stunning with the Rhone seated picnics being a great, novel idea.

Despite having very generous portions, for the price the picnic had some very poorly made elements. The humus was hard and seemed old. Also the cabbage salad was very roughly cut, totally dry with some elements of the salad that seemed to be bits of skin and even a few unwashed radishes in it. 

There was also a 10 % service charge for the table which would be fair enough however there is not enough service to justify this. We had a table for 14, the picnics were dumped in a pile, we then cleared up all the plates at the end. As well as this we needed to get up a few times to order drinks. This was by no means the fault of the waitress rather the fact that they were over loaded.

Lastly I felt that as the picnic was packed in advance it was very wasteful in the amount of excess packaging they created. 

It was such an amazing location, I hope that these can be remedied as it could be so much better.
Shout out to Pusi! Super host. Awesome and affordable wines. Just go!

ChIJb_fYuOqvzR0RVTymUd8-0F0.vicinity: R310 Pniel Road, Groot Drakenstein, Franshhoek

reviews.text: My wife and I visited Grande Provence Heritage Wine Estate in October 2016. Ordered a supply of their wine and had it shipped to my home in Florida. Just opened a bottle and found it to be superb as it was when we tasted it at the wine estate. Had a great tour and conversation with the employees while visiting in 2016. Will have to find a source in the USA. Again, outstanding.
Fantastic location. The restaurant is very good and allows you to drink good wines.  Excellent service from nice people.  Go for it.
Breathtaking surroundings. Incredible food. Fine wines. A memorable experience!
Service was very inattentive. In addition, although timelines were communicated, these had been ignored. Filet was of median quality. Cauliflower in Risotto was very hard.
Had a beautiful wine tasting sitting outside, beautiful sculptures and overall ambiance, will be going back soon
A hidden 'in'-gem in the Stellenbosch Winelands! Authentic and real, yet stylish and elegant. Highly popular amongst the foodie crowd. Fantastic wines, relaxed atmosphere, amazing lawn and garden.
Delicious food, amazing wine! The owners will make your experience awesome. I really enjoyed it & can just recommend it.
Best wine around Stellenbosch. Great authentic athmosphere.
Ons het n wynproe gedoen Saterdag en was aangenaam verras. Vriendelike en hulpvaardige personeel en uitstekende wyne. Pragtige perseel. Ek kom weer.
J'aime

Great bubbles, friendly pourer
Lovely place, lovely wines.
Bubbles ....bubbles. ...chardonnay. ..
Lovely setting, wonderful tasting

reviews.text: Beautiful setting for brunch. Attentive, friendly staff. The duck run is great to watch.

The famous farm with the Runner bred of ducks managing the sand-snail population in an organic way stopping these destructive mollusks from destroying the vines - great venue for a stop-off for a bite to eat too. The restaurant was being refurbished so can't comment on the offering yet
Superb atmosphere.  Gorgeous gardens to relax in. Kids friendly.
Beautiful venue!
Good

reviews.text: I worked here selling (and tasting) the wines and it is to this day one of my favourite places on earth!!!
Whimsical and wonderful with fantastic port. Totally unique.

reviews.text: Went there last week Sunday, booked a table for 15 at the Tables restaurant. The fish on the fish and chips dish was overcooked using what I thought was old oil. The lady from the table across from us kept shoving our kids away from their table when they walked past strangely enough after one of the patrons actually complimented us on our kids good behaviour. I'm not sure if the lady across from us was racist in doing what she did. To top it all off one of the patrons from a larger party, knocked into my car laughed and drove off, the manager at the time said they would follow up and get back to me. To this day I have had no feedback. Money not well spent.
Beautiful setting on the deck. Breakfast was perfect and not too pricey. Service great.
Great place and amazing service.  Definitely worth a return visit.
Terrible prices, R150 for a bottle of wine? And R70 for a burger? Loved watershed though
Wine tasting room excellent with good wuality wine and service. A must visit

ChIJyzLBkCxYzB0R33-poH7V_Gw.adr_address: Hooggelegen Rd, Durbanville, Cape Town, 7551, South Africa
ChIJyzLBkCxYzB0R33-poH7V_Gw.formatted_address: Hooggelegen Rd, Durbanville, Cape Town, 7551, South Africa
ChIJyzLBkCxYzB0R33-poH7V_Gw.name: Signal Gun Wines

reviews.text: I'll edit the review once I've tried the restaurant but the beer tasting was good. Go on a Tuesday for a tasting special. You have got to try the berry lime wine cooler they have. It is absolutely phenomenal. Parking is a bit scarce but a sedan or hatchback will be able to make the trip there and back. Only a small section and parking lot is gravel. Love the hill would like to take a trip to the top sometime provided it isn't 39Â°C again ðŸ˜‚. Apparently quite full on Saturdays but Sundays are more relaxed. Go on Tuesday though

5 stars for when I was here the previous 2 times. There were about 3 guys who were watering and attending to everyone and they were brilliant. This time I havent even seen a waiter or waitress so I don't know who has been attending to anyone. I've been here 20 minutes, there are two tables and the cleaning lady inside keeps assuring me that someone will come and take my order. This is disgusting how the service has dismally decreased in only 4 months. Please get your previous staff members back and pay them double because they know what they are doing and they did a great job. I will never recommend Signal gun to anyone if this is the service I get.

RESTAURANT (NOT WINE TASTING): 2 stars

Pro's: Great place for lunch outside on a nice spring/summer day, with pretty views of the wine lands. Pizza, wine and service was also not bad.

Con's: Not a great atmosphere inside for a dinner at all - avoid going if you are there for the romantic scene. Place seriously needs a decorator and some TLC! Bit overpriced and run down.

WINE TASTING: 4 stars

Great atmosphere for a beer of wine tasting, sitting on a bean bag looking over the winelands! Delicious craft beers and wine.
Some of the best craft and wine pairings in the Cape. Couple that with live music and you have a recipe for perfection
Great beer and wine. Very very slow service.

reviews.text: Great wine! Great ambiance! Great, friendly service! If you are close stop and taste!!!

Absolutely love this place! The word "family" instantly comes to mind when I think of this beautiful place. Great wines, great service and an absolutely to-die-for selection of platters paired with a beautiful and peaceful ambience.
Nice ambiance and good service. Wines good as well
Wonderful wine and interesting tasing room with individual rooms as well
Great cheese platter with excellent wines and even greater service!

ChIJoUEowlZYzB0RUAEzoVxzAzc.vicinity: Tygerberg Valley Road, Durbanville, Cape Town

reviews.text: Very relaxed and authentic experience. Never felt like "just-one-more-taster", in fact she stayed open and relaxed with us, made us feel very welcome. And the WINES! Immediately bought cases for my wedding. We loved it, guests at the wedding loved it too. No regrets.
Good wines and friendly people
Good
Beautiful surroundings

reviews.text: Beautiful wine warm. Awesome wines especially 2012 red blend !

Excellent varied terrain. The red route has moderate difficulty and several really fun gentle downhill sections through forest.

This map marker is nowhere near the parking!! Use the "Oak Valley Estate" map marker for navigation instead. The MTB parking is just inside the estate after you pass through the gate.
Beautifull wine estate, did a trail run on the farm which has awesome trails and bike tracks.
Beautiful estate and lovely wine!

Enjoyed a great lunch around the pool.
Awesome setting

ChIJEVgwpAbfzR0RoYR7zm6jycw.adr_address: R43, Bot River Lagoon, Walker Bay, Hermanus, 7200, South Africa
ChIJEVgwpAbfzR0RoYR7zm6jycw.formatted_address: R43, Bot River Lagoon, Walker Bay, Hermanus, 7200, South Africa
ChIJEVgwpAbfzR0RoYR7zm6jycw.name: Benguela Cove Lagoon Wine Estate

reviews.text:
I have take same gust from Pretoria  out for lunch on the 26 December 2017 to your restaurant. I deside to try a new place. We book for 6 at the restaurant but on arrival they did not know of us but we was help friendly. We was seated outside on our request. Great venue and nice relax atmosphere. Love the space around the tables and that i do not have to listen to somebody else conversation. 
The wine was good but a bit pricey for what you get. (Only wine and soft drinks available.)
The waiter gives u 2 menu's to order from?? Every time we need him we have to look for him and call him. We ask about the cheese  and meat  platters and the waiters could not tel us what was on it so we deside to skip it. 
The starters we order was tasty but the main was bad. 
We order sirloin  medium to rare and it was well done. My friend order rare and it was medium to well. The meat was to thin cut and rubbery texture. Relay not what I expected. The fish that some had was average and not what we expected from a fine restaurant.
Over all, I was very disappointing because the greater Hermanus have very good Estates, restaurants with great food and nice views that offer better value.
Great atmosphere, live music and view of lake. Decent wines but a bit pricey.
Awesome Wine Estate with nice food and great views. Brand new.
This place is so beautiful and the staff is so friendly and helpful.
Brand new and nice staff but cheeses that accompanies wine was mainly European so a bit disappointing.

ChIJEVgwpAbfzR0RoYR7zm6jycw.vicinity: R43, Bot River Lagoon, Walker Bay, Hermanus

ChIJE_Yw4RqszR0Rr21MmQUkBG0.adr_address: Valley Road - Off R44, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJE_Yw4RqszR0Rr21MmQUkBG0.formatted_address: Valley Road - Off R44, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJE_Yw4RqszR0Rr21MmQUkBG0.name: Marianne Wine Estate

reviews.text:
This was an amazing experience, My wife and I had the best of times. The accommodation was incredible, and the facilities were just wonderful. The staff were super friendly and couldnâ€™t do enough for us. The wine was fantastic as was the staffs knowledge of the it. We had supper in the FlorÃ©al restaurant which was delicious and very reasonably priced.
Overall I would recommend Marianne to everyone and we shall certainly be heading back there. 

Thank you to everyone who made our stay so memorable. 

Gemma and Charlotte.

Excellent excellent winery. The location has amazing views, and the wines were delicious. The 2014 Cab Sauv is excellent. Itâ€™s a bit posh and not really child friendly, they have meat and cheese boards no picnic. Highly highly recommend.

This also one of our favorites!! Atmosphere is fantastic, this is the type of wine farm where you can sit for hours and just have a great time with your lived one or friends. Their wines are superb and super friendly staff. Apart from that seating has a great view!
What an amazing experience. Had the pleasure of tasting some of the finest wines Stellenbosch has to offer with the friendliest staff. See you again soon!
Nice place, nice view. Did not like their wine too much. We came to taste 6 wines. None of them were my taste.

ChIJYYBvB3hMzB0RtQRYwFvrzGk.adr_address: Baden Powell Drive, Stellenbosch, 7599, South Africa
ChIJYYBvB3hMzB0RtQRYwFvrzGk.formatted_address: Baden Powell Drive, Stellenbosch, 7599, South Africa
ChIJYYBvB3hMzB0RtQRYwFvrzGk.name: Meerlust Wine Estate

reviews.text:
Incredible wine â€“ Highly Recommended!

The wine farm has a rich family history since 1756 (eight generations of Myburghâ€™s). Creating award winning wines that will leave you more then satisfied. Try the famous flagship Meerlust Rubicon (red wine) and youâ€™ll be hooked! 

The spectacular originally preserved Cape Dutch main house will transport you back in time to the early settlers and the Cape colony. Youâ€™ll feel relaxed in the rustic tasting room where the team of friendly and knowledgeable staff will assist and educate you about the farm, history and wines. 

Itâ€™s one of the only places where you actually get to taste the flagship wines! Other must-haves are the Merlot and the local Chardonnay (white wine). The wines are well priced and affordable (Wine Club members get additional discount â€“ So sign up asap!). You wonâ€™t leave disappointedâ€¦ ENJOY!

After 12 months of planning our wine tasting route, Meerlust was a must, we thought this would be our GRANDE Finale, What an absolute disappointment, the Staff (Jill) was totally not interested, the wine tasting was rushed and not explained clearly, it was as if we were there at closing time. We ended up buying a 1.5lt Rubicon, because it is such a beautiful wine, the cold reception and unprofessional staff really ruined our last day. What a total disappointment!
Very informal tasting , great wines on a real family owned estate .

You can't visit Stellenbosch or the wine regions of South Africa without paying a visit to Meerlust Estate. This is a magical place with world-renowned wines, that changed the route of South African wine making. The 17-century main house is a national monument and the whole farm simply stunning! The people are absolutely lovely and they will be happy to take you through the Estate's wines. Do call in advance to book a wine tasting with the team!
Wine is excellent thank you

ChIJvYCDpzzFzR0RRvpASYUuNQQ.adr_address: Viljoenshoop Road 50, Grabouw, 7160, South Africa
ChIJvYCDpzzFzR0RRvpASYUuNQQ.name: Almenkerk Wine Estate

reviews.text: According to Google, Platters and every sign in the area leading you there, Almenkerk is open on Sundays, so imagine driving 80km to get there only to find the gate closed.  Not cool.
Excellent wines, very warm welcome, awesome views and splendid architecture
Awesome wine. Has art as well, and beautiful setting.
Good wines, friendly & knowledgeable staff and a beautiful view. Wish they had a deli or a restaurant.
Good wines awesome views

ChIJAQAAAByyzR0RT-hoZGJUuGo.adr_address: Helshoogte Rd, Stellenbosch Central, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJAQAAAByyzR0RT-hoZGJUuGo.formatted_address: Helshoogte Rd, Stellenbosch Central, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJAQAAAByyzR0RT-hoZGJUuGo.name: Zorgvliet Wine Estate

reviews.text: I will never forget my experience at Zorgvliet Wine Estate. My husband and I were married there only a few weeks ago. The estate and chapel were more beautiful than I could have even dreamed. The owners and staff were extremely accommodating considering my husband and I planned our wedding in 5 hours. They provided a room for me to get dressed and prepared the chapel in very little time. Colin, our tour guide and an employee at Zorgvliet, orchestrated the entire evening perfectly, connecting us with photographers, an officiant, etc. and we couldn't have been more grateful for or impressed by his speedy work. We are so grateful and definitely recommend Zorgvliet to everyone!
This a wonderful wine estate with fantastic wines and food. It is one of the most beautiful places I have ever been. It's a great place to come and have a picnic and a glass of wine.
Went there for a wine tasting. Absolutely stunning place and easily the most beautiful wine farm I've seen in the area. All of our group liked the wine very much.

I am an Uber driver most of the people they normally ask me where to go especially on the wine farms I recommend that that wine farm my sister she get married there I love this saves that they have they are the best
I love you! You're estate and wine is amazing & I will be back! C'est La Vie!
Ah, superb!! The tasting experience is exceptional, always accommodating, and the staff are very friendly. 100% can recommend!

Very accommodating. We called to make a booking but were warned that they are very busy. Even though they still managed to get us a seat by the fire place. 

Great service and friendly staff are attentive. Platters are great but the ðŸ· is lacking. The vistas are gorgeous with great photo ops for photography.

I really enjoyed my experience here. The wine tasting was very affordable, yet the wines were of very good quality. With every wine tasting, flavours and wine making processes were explained. And with the stunning mountain and ocean views and crackling fire going in the fireplace, makes it a perfect relaxing place for a chilli winter's afternoon.
The Pinotage is great, and the view is amazing even on a rainy day.
Very friendly and professional service. Exceptional wines. Beautiful views.

ChIJl6qqqhq9zR0RL6K-moe0xVs.adr_address: Green Valley Rd, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJl6qqqhq9zR0RL6K-moe0xVs.formatted_address: Green Valley Rd, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJl6qqqhq9zR0RL6K-moe0xVs.name: Holden Manz Wine Estate

reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic place to be. In the heart of Franschoek and the scenery is beautiful. Was there for an event and was blown away with the service and great food. Wine tours are available and well worth it. Did I mention how good the wine is?
Lovely atmosphere and amazing food and wine!

We loved this place! The Setting is beautiful and peaceful and overall it's a small enough environment to be intimate. We had lunch and the food was fantastic. Stunning presentation, great flavour combinations and good quality ingredients. The service was good too. The Good Sport dessert wine is delicious and we bought a couple of bottles to take home with us. A great day out in Franschoek and we will definitely return.

As part of the wine tour, we went to Holden Manz. The place has good views. They also have a large green area with a water body near the restaurant for the kids to play. The tasting was good and the server was kind enough to change our wines as part of tasting as we prefer white over red wines.  We also had the cheese platter which had good variety and was good.
Very slow service. We couldnt finish wine tasting
A small hidden gem of a wine estate, with great views and fantastic wines.

At the end of this Rainbow, you'll fine a pot of liquid gold in the way of great wines, friendly family and staff.  Good informative presentation before you sit out on the family's terrace with its' breathtaking views and enjoy great wine and company

ChIJMWIHXcyyzR0Rfx6H4JpNTGA.adr_address: Polkadraai Road, Stellenbosch, 7600, South Africa
ChIJMWIHXcyyzR0Rfx6H4JpNTGA.name: Asara Wine Estate & Hotel

reviews.text: Excellent wine! Excellent service! Tasting room nice, but no outdoor scenery.
Serene setting, with panoramic view of Stellenbosch. Great deli and patisserie. Expensive gin options.
One of the Best Wine farms in Stellenbosch. Beautiful view. Great wine tasting. (Noble Harvest).
Exceptional views and the most comfortable and spacious rooms. The breakfast spread is huge and can be enjoyed while looking over the Stellenbosch valley. A true five-star experience
Awesome farm with great wine. Excellent food and service.

La Motte is an amazing winery! It's been around since the 1600s and their wine is phenomenal. The landscape is beautiful and the tasting room is a mix between vintage and modern architecture. La Motte's staff is very friendly and has a lot of knowledge about all the different wines they offer. They make an excellent Merlot and Cab Sav!

La Motte is a lovely estate. Small but with lots to see and do. The restaurant, Pierneef a la Motte, is a really visually stunning place, and it offers indoor, outdoor and deck seating overlooking the pond. They offer a good Winelands tea (not the most filling, but high quality) aside from the standard meals. There is also a fascinating museum, in honour of the famous SA landscape artist, Pierneef. (Entry is free and it is worth a visit.) There is also a small farm shop and a chic winetasting room to enjoy at the estate.

The quality of food and of course wine is outstanding. Visited for both breakfast and lunch, equally as good. During Summer, having lunch next to the pond, with a glass of Chardonnay, is highly recommended.

I've always loved La Motte wines so you can imagine how excited I was to visit this venue! From start to finish it was an incredible experience. Having some wines in front of a crackling fire, the ladies helping with the tasting were incredibly friendly, and with such good quality wines.....it is definitely worth the drive out! The wines are available for purchase and at quite good rates too. This lace is a must visit on your trip to Franschoek.
We had wonderful time with my guest and really we did Enjoy , staff very friendly

ChIJEXoUs9ppzB0RzHENeddpBUY.adr_address: Groot Constantia Rd, Constantia, Cape Town, 7806, South Africa
ChIJEXoUs9ppzB0RzHENeddpBUY.formatted_address: Groot Constantia Rd, Constantia, Cape Town, 7806, South Africa
ChIJEXoUs9ppzB0RzHENeddpBUY.name: Groot Constantia

reviews.text: We visited the Jonkershuis restaurant for our year end lunch. Enjoyed every minute of it. We were seated outside under the trees and took in the spectacular view! The food was really good (we selected the celebration menu) and fantastic value for money. I even had a chance to purchase some wines to take home. Overall a wonderful experience and will definitely return!
It remains the best winery in the Cape. Best cuisine and location. You can easily lose yourself in the past. Beautiful gardens and historical buildings. Very elegant.

Great experience eating at the restaurant. Epic views and tranquility. Did not do the wine tasting, but I did buy some great wines. The lovely lady at the counter assisted me with a sample of their excellent Pinotage. Can't wait to go back and do the wine tour.
What a beautiful setting. Really busy in season, but still a great experience with amazing wine. You even get to keep your tasting glass.

The atmosphere in the courtyard is wonderful with a chic/rustic feel, it gives you the feeling of an outside space without having to deal with the extremities of the Cape Town weather. 

The snoek patÃª is fantastic. 
And it's hard to go wrong with the Groot Constantia wines. 

We also had a lovely waiter who was attentive and who had us at ease from the word go. 

Overall a great experience.

ChIJEXoUs9ppzB0RzHENeddpBUY.vicinity: Groot Constantia Road, Constantia, Cape Town

ChIJI93jD2uszR0R8cfBCHWX5rg.adr_address: Lievland Wine Estate at Route 44, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, Western Cape,, South Africa, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, 7625, South Africa
ChIJI93jD2uszR0R8cfBCHWX5rg.formatted_address: Lievland Wine Estate at Route 44, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, Western Cape,, South Africa, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, 7625, South Africa
ChIJI93jD2uszR0R8cfBCHWX5rg.name: Lievland Wine Estate

reviews.text: 3 Impi's done at Lievland. Really great place to test your mettle. I'll definitely be back for more punishment.

ChIJI93jD2uszR0R8cfBCHWX5rg.vicinity: Lievland Wine Estate at Route 44, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch, Western Cape,, South Africa, Klapmuts, Stellenbosch

ChIJAzp1dFmszR0RhekYH-fu1QY.adr_address: R44, Stellenbosch Central, Stellenbosch, 7607, South Africa
ChIJAzp1dFmszR0RhekYH-fu1QY.formatted_address: R44, Stellenbosch Central, Stellenbosch, 7607, South Africa
ChIJAzp1dFmszR0RhekYH-fu1QY.name: Kanonkop Wine Estate

reviews.text:
I give only 4* only because of the experience. The wines are stunning! So rich aromas and wonderful bouquets! But the wine tasting as an experience was very poor and weak.  

The young lady at the counter just pointed her finger at the price list with the wine names, waited for the order and poured the wines. Swollen words about the wine itself... Maybe she was too tired at early afternoon - difficult to say.

Anyway, even without the explanations :( we could appreciate the wines. Kanonkop deserves the name "the master of pinotage" in the country. 
Very well done! 

Got several bottles for home. Again, great wines! 
Best Pinotage in the country!
One of our favorite stops on wine tours. Educational and fine wine. Especially rewarding at harvest time. Ask about shipping wine back. Reasonable and quick.

One of the nicest evenings we've had in a long time. Fantastic food and wine. The owners go out of their way to make the evening special. We felt welcome and enjoyed ourselves immensely. Well done. Keep it up.
Quiet, chill and friendly. Also awesome wine and great stories. Be sure to drive by if you have a chance. Heard second hand stories about them being a great provider of wine to big parties.
One of Stellenbosch's iconic wine farms. Great wine, especially the Pinotage. Staff are knowledgeable.
Wow. Wow. Amazing. Excellent food, wines and service. Book in advance to make sure you get a good spot. Take one of the golf carts to the top of the vineyard and enjoy the jaw dropping views.

Some of the best views at any estate. If you can get one of the guys with the golf carts to take you all the way up, you can literally see as far as Cape Town. The food was also excellent and the service really good.
Just beautiful, a must visit in cape town. Stunning art, garden and restaurant. It was quite crowded on a sunday when we went there. So you may got to make a reservation if you'd like to eat here.
Spectacular views and a top quality destination. No expense spared in creating a desirable destination for visitors.
The most surprising and phenomenal estate with beautiful gardens, sculptures and astounding views in every direction

ChIJOySTK4IIzR0RhaLeTQLD9Oc.adr_address: R301, Jan Van Riebeeck Dve, Newtown, The Diemersfontein Village, Wellington, 7655, South Africa
ChIJOySTK4IIzR0RhaLeTQLD9Oc.formatted_address: R301, Jan Van Riebeeck Dve, Newtown, The Diemersfontein Village, Wellington, 7655, South Africa
ChIJOySTK4IIzR0RhaLeTQLD9Oc.name: Diemersfontein Wine & Country Estate

reviews.text: Restaurant often very unwelcoming; strange hours. Have had one very good experience there. Tasting room great - friendly staff.

I liked the very good views and the crackers and cheese served at the wine tasting. The staff at the restaurant said that the card machine was not working. I had to pay in cash at the restaurant, but I could pay with my card at the wine tasting centre.

Stairs from parking to venue. Small children's play area.
Shower pathetic... security major turnoff from the start. Bed is broken just horrible
Great Wedding Venue and awesome photo opportunities for wedding photographers!
Delicious restaurant with a breathtaking view!

ChIJOySTK4IIzR0RhaLeTQLD9Oc.vicinity: R301, Jan Van Riebeeck Dve, Newtown, Wellington

ChIJE-MlUpavzR0Rd2-jSNrCat8.adr_address: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, Franschhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJE-MlUpavzR0Rd2-jSNrCat8.formatted_address: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, Franschhoek, 7680, South Africa
ChIJE-MlUpavzR0Rd2-jSNrCat8.name: Allee Bleue Estate

reviews.text:
We received directions from security at the front gate, spot on. The picnic area was easy to find.

We then arrived at the entrance to the picnic area and was escorted to our tables (has to be booked beforehand) by our waitron which done so in a kind and friendly manner.

We then settled in and made the kids comfortable by escorting them to the jumping castle and jungle gym. The entire picnic area is walled in so the kids can only exit at the entrance which makes it easy to keep an eye on them. We appreciated the kids friendly picnic area.

The food was delicious and sufficient.

They even offer a kiddies picnic platter.

We then took our time and had great fun and the service was good. 

Only once did the waiter forget to bring our my soft drink but overall we would recommend it for the families with toddlers and even babies.
Excellent wines. The venue has vast and stunning vineyards and lanscape. Our wineÂ steward was delightfully entertaining. Coffee was good, breakfast was impecable.
The service and the food was really great. A very tranquil setting with enough to do for children
The picnic baskets were amazing. Good quality for the price! Lovely day under the trees!!
Great venue. Lovely wines

ChIJE-MlUpavzR0Rd2-jSNrCat8.vicinity: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, Franschhoek

ChIJfzKu7VtXzB0R9sepIOCnAMg.adr_address: Tygerberg Valley Rd, Cape Farms, Cape Town, 7551, South Africa
ChIJfzKu7VtXzB0R9sepIOCnAMg.formatted_address: Tygerberg Valley Rd, Cape Farms, Cape Town, 7551, South Africa
ChIJfzKu7VtXzB0R9sepIOCnAMg.name: Altydgedacht

reviews.text: Great wine, excellent food (bourbon burger was amazing!), service was a bit slow but very friendly. Beautiful setting as well! Second time there, and will definitely be back soon.

Deeply unimpressed at the change of ownership. For the past 10-15 years the Altydgedaght restaurant has been wonderful - good value for money and delicious food. Prices have increased since the change in ownership and the quality has decreased. When being seated we were not informed of anything being out of stock, but the wine we ordered was out, as was their chicken pot pie and fish. The menus are grubby and cringe worthy, with pages missing from some. When we informed the waiter in a friendly and respectful way that we were not happy with the quality of the service and the lack of their basic offerings, he was unapologetic. Despite living in the area and being regular visitors, we will not be returning.

Food was not up to standard. Did not receive all the ingredients stated on the menu. Calamari was overcooked and chewy. Salad was so small not worth R80. After waiting for more than 15 min to complain to the kitchen manager we left...hungry and dissapointed. Never again
Always great to visit and experience the tranquility and good foid and wine.
Food and wine are great; rating because of bad service/hostess manners the past month. Unaccommodating.

reviews.text: Amazing food and great wine, the service was average however. The duck in particular was awesome!

This need to fall in you ball park. This place is way expensive. Not sure if a 5 star chef works here? 
We had some coffee, which if you ask me was not that great for a upper class restaurant. I was to afraid of ordering something of the menu as if the coffee experience is what I am going to get in comparison to the food, I would rather not take the chance. 
Don't get me wrong the place looks stunning. Service was great, but I am that type of person that has a massive issues with anything being overpriced. 
For food the be expensive, the items on the plate either need to be expensive to come by. Or have a unique touch you can not find somewhere else. Guess this place is more for tourists that have no sense of local prices for what you get.
Lovely MCC. Great service. Great views. Will be back. Thanks

I've had lunch and dinner here a few times, great food, lovely wines, friendly and attentive staff. Fireplace makes it very cosy in winter and in summer there are tables outside overlooking the horses.
Beautiful with excellent food and lovely service.

reviews.text: Nice atmosphere but service not up to scratch. Wine tasting had too few waiters resulting in us having to get up from the veranda and get our own wine. Cheese platter good and arrived promptly.
Pleasant wines. Decent size burger but not the best I've had. Outside deck area very pleasant, but  clean up of vacated tables unusually slow.

We've just had the pleasure of visiting D'Aria for a wine tasting and were blown away! Their tastings are R20 for 5 wines (which are all fabulous!) Their Cheese & Meat platters are extremely abundant and affordable - R150 for all this which is over enough for 2 people!!! Gorgeous setting, beautiful pond, wooden deck, tables on the lawn, (bring a picnic blanket if you want) kids play area, expansive laws for kids to kick a ball, enough paving for older kids to skateboard on, fireplace inside. They're very popular and their wines are very affordable. R45 for a bottle of fabulous D'Aria Music. Open 7 days a week. Weekends from 11am - 4pm. We're hooked!
Waited an hour and a quarter and still no food. Got a glass of champagne because of long wait. We were the first guests and the other 2 tables got food before us. And all this on my birthday!!
Beautiful facilities. Service not great. Also, sign on the road said they were open for wine tasting when they were not.

This was definitely one of the most peaceful stays our family ever had. It's perfect for a weekend out of the city to just be. Thanks for treating us!
Wonderful location and wine

home away from home.
Amazing cottages in a fabulous wine estate.
Mike & mel are so great and make the stay even more cosy.
Wish to come back and we even didnt left yet...

I liked their Sauvignon Blanc and especially their red wine blend called the "one man band".
Great farm and very reasonably priced wines!

reviews.text:
A touch and go 3 star overall, but being in a festive mood, having had some decent wine, I decided to be generous. 

A beautiful venue, but food is below par and the service was OK on a very quite afternoon.

14pax for three course lunch and one raved about a dish, the pasta. When a medium rare steak is killed and oxtail is tough, then something needs to drastically change in the kitchen. 

PS: Been a while since I had snails. These were well prepared and delicate. The garlic was a little to light for my liking.

The kids enjoyed it. I had a problem with their menu. I ordered nougat parcels as dessert and didn't get cherry chocolate icecream as stated on the menu. When I complained they gave me more vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce with a cherry on top. Not impressed at all.

This place offers a good variety for adults and kids. They have a winning combination but the service levels needs to be taken to the next level. There is loads of entertainment and fun for a kids day outing. The food is average a bit pricey.
Was a nice relaxing experience with beautiful views and an amazing area for the kids to play, together with good wine and company an all round great experience...
Attended a conference at the venue. Loved the location and grounds are stunning. However, the catering was rather poor and can do with upping their game.

I cannot believe that somewhere can operate like this they think that an assurance that this hasn't happened before makes it ok. Opportunity for walks on the property are endless, with beautiful views and varied landscapes. The privacy of the property guarantees security.
The staff took care of us in the most kind and caring manner. Breakfasts were a feast.
Our visit brings happy memories!

reviews.text: They're a boutique wine farm and wine tasting is by appointment only. They have a gorgeous intimate venue for hire with a fireplace, leather couches and a stunning view of their vineyard. Their red wine is simply exquisite! And the owner, Magdaleen blew us away with her warmth and friendliness.

Boschendal is a majestic estate with something for everyone. From food to mountain biking. There are a deli and restaurant with picnic facilities under the shades of beautiful trees. Mountain bikes can be rented and ridden on the flowing trail network on the other side of the road. There are also a few guesthouses available for those who want to experience the farm life overnight.
Great picnics, farm-to-table cuisine,wine and food pairing, lots of activities,beautiful scenery, good guest experience, family friendly. Enough to keep you entertained the whole day.
Great place, awesome wines. This place is so beautiful and open.
An excellent (previously owned by Cycil John Rhodes) wine estate with wines that is known globally
Great views, great wines. They were very accommodating when we messed up the reservation for our picnic.

Visited February 2014

reviews.text:
It's hard to decide what is better, the wine, the views or the cheese platters, regardless of which is best they are all amazing.

I would recommend the reserve wine tasting option as all four wines are outstanding. The staff are extremely knowledgeable about the wines and friendly. Lots of laughs and just great vibes.
Great space, food, beer and wine. Animal lovers will appreciate the 7 chilled out dogs plus zebras, antelope, and wildebeest wandering the property too.

My husband and I stayed at Zebra Cottage which is a small house on the wine estate for a week. We loved it. We walked through the vineyards and up into the hills. The cottage itself was a bit rustic and could have been tidier, but we loved the veranda, the six winery dogs, and the beautiful views. I have only one complaint. We stayed on the grounds of a winery, and no one made an effort to talk to us about the wine! If there had been a welcome bottle on the table with a note, or if anyone on the property had offered to give us a tour or even schedule a tasting, we would have been thrilled. Perhaps the focus on the winery is not the two rental houses...I understand. It was still a terrific place to stay. It is just unfortunate we had to go wine tasting somewhere else.
terrible service- when we arrived the tasting room staff did not greet or welcome us. Left because of this
Excellent service with the best wines

One of my happiest Mother's Day memories! The view is beyond words and the interior both classy and stylish. Going for a wine tasting here is a unique and special experience. The waiters and bar staff are very knowledgeable, and such fun to have around! It's a real pleasure taking it all in: the wine, the food, the people! Some menu items are a bit pricey, but they're worth it.

Idiom has that special Italian touch, with super unfussy service, classy but relaxed wine tasting with yummy Italian variatals. We had delicious thin crusted pizza, with bread and special red wine infused onion and parsley flavored butter as well as tamato gazpacho thrown in with the deal!
Gordious food, superb wine does not come for a bargain and breathtaking views. Road up is like a climb in the Dolomites.
Unbelievable views with great food. Really enjoyed the pizzas and wine tasting.

reviews.text: Oh you have to go here. It's beautiful. The staff are so nice you want to steal one and put him in your car boot. First time horse riding for me, and I'm a changed man. Wife cantered away, but Edward looked after me. The restaurant, Forage, is superb. And their champagne. Best kept secret. And the pinotage.

We headed out to Botriver the past weekend for the annual " Over the Rainbow" festival and we were not disappointed. One of the estate visited was the picturesque Wilde krans, majestiv views and the most beautiful spring blossoms. The wines were exceptional although I was verh conflicted by the delightful Sauvignon Blanc "Shark" for on my visit check oug my instagram page @throughmywineglass

We were very disappointed. The wine was not pleasant and the service at the tasting room was terrible - we kept having to ask for the next wine. We also couldn't understand how the wines have so many awards but we didn't feel the wine was very nice. We had ordered food - which was delicious. There seems to be a miscommunication however because when we asked for the bill it was a whole complication because the food and the wine are two different companies.
Best place ever. Wish I could give 6 stars!!

The Foage Restaurant is amazing. The Wine is good. But the Restaurant Racione is completely over Priced. You get ordinary foot to an Price more expansive as in the Foage Restaurant. Help yourself and Do not visit this Restaurant. Please Note I gave Foage at Tripadvisor an exzellent. I am shocked about Racione. Go to Spur or MacDonals and with the Money you Safe you can buy some cases of Wine.
