reviews.text: Great wine tasting place and they have a simple lunch menu. The restaurant is extraordinary. The best restaurant experience we had in South Africa. Fantastic food and staff. If you can get a booking. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Stellenbosch.
Stunning setting, in the top 100 wines in Wine Spectator. Fabulous lunch under the trees.

A number of years ago, we stumbled upon Rust en Vrede after leaving Ernie Els very hungry and in high dudgeon at the cost/value ratio. At Rust and Vrede, we began with a wine tasting and, upon being told that the wine tasting would be gratis if we opted to have the Chalmar sirloin lunch, we were simply too greedy to resist. We accepted the offer. This turned out to be an excellent decision: the meat was beautifully tender and tasty, the salad came up to expectation, and the chips were perfection. Furthermore, our waiter must have been new to the game (we now realise) because she practically filled our wine glasses to the brim. Consequently I left there in a state of high glee and giggled my way back home (no, I was not driving). Yesterday, we returned to Rust en Vrede, having finally remembered its name and figured out its locality (very simple: turn off the R44 at the Annandale intersectionright at the end of the road that passes Root 44's entrance). We discovered that the menu has doubled (there are now all of TWO dishes on the menu, both exceptionally delicious and well executed - the Chalmar sirloin remains, and is joined by Salmon and asparagus). The wine is still very good, though no longer quite so copious; and the beauty of the venue remains unspoilt. No dessert on the menu; only coffee, but what delicious coffee, and served in Le Creuset cups (of an unusual soft teal green colour), which keep the coffee at a good temperature for longer than usual. The service is excellent; the seating is simple yet elegantly comfortable. The frites might well be the best in S.A.
Best wine!! Best steak and chips!! Love this place
Beautiful under the trees. The wine is great and food looks divine

reviews.text: Wonderful food. And very fair pricing. The place is also not as posh as other vineyards. Very good!
Awesome view, delicious food and prices very reasonable. Love this place.
The rooms and breakfast were fantastic, not to mention the breathtaking mountains and surrounds. Wine tasting was excellent and also their conference facilities.Highly recommended!

Stayed for one night in their family area (two rooms) which was actually excellent, spacious, clean with great views over the lake and mountains. Housekeeping did ask if we had everything, but only found out when we went to bed the sofa bed wasnâ€™t big enough for two teenage children and that we only had 5 duvets for 6 of us...

The service in the restaurant area was poor and just felt like they didnâ€™t care that much and were more interested in staff/friends at the bar

We did wine tasting in the afternoon â€“ a selection of 4 wines were eventually poured with no description or any comment at all. About 10 minutes later a friendly young waiter came over and asked if they had been described, which he then did after apologising. Needless to say even though the wine was lovely we didnâ€™t buy any.

Had a similar experience in the evening for dinner. The food was excellent, the waitress pleasant and apologetic, but it should not take nearly an hour to get starters out in virtually empty restaurant (there were no more than 4 other tables)

Breakfast was great, but beware if staying Saturday nights as the busy road outside is used as a racetrack by motorbikes Sunday mornings!

Overall I could not recommend which is a shame, as would take very little to make it amazing

Well, you would need to check out this Lilith gem on your way to Franschoek. The Chef Reg Smith makes it his business to visit each and every table to chat to his Customers and the food especially the pork belly is absolutely stunning. It has a fireplace to warm you on a cold winters day and has inside and outside seating. Homely good food and value for money. Small attraction for kids and a play park.

The platters are beautifully presented and full of different elements from vegetables to cheeses to pÃ¢tÃ©. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable about most of what goes on, on the farm. Didnâ€™t try the restaurant, but whether you just go for a wine tasting or go for a meal, itâ€™s a definite â€˜must tryâ€™.

This is such a wonderful farm! Wine tasting, excellent food and a beautiful garden to explore. The deli and scent shop are great and they recently opened a bakery and butchery on site. The prices are steep but the quality is excellent. Entry is R10 per person during the week and R20 per person on weekends. This place is very popular so get there around 9am to beat the crowds. The Greenhouse sells popsicles at the Entrance which is great on a hot day.

This is an absolutely enchanting farm with the most spectacular views. Just walking through the extensive gardens alone will leave you feeling like youâ€™re in a fairytale world. The farms offers wine tasting and has two restaurants one of which is set in a greenhouse and the other is by reservation only (Babel). I would highly recommend this place for a day out with the family. Donâ€™t forget to check out the zen garden!

Absolutely beautiful. Babylonstoren takes exceptional good care of their gardens and their animals and I would visit just to walk through the gardens. The greenhouse restaurant is cosy and the food is decent. Recommended for anyone who wants to get the best out of the Western Cape. No matter your interests, chances are that you'll find something for you here.

Gorgeous place, lovely to spend hours exploring the exquisite garden's. The "farm shop" is the worst type of tourist trap, and the restaurants on site (Babel with its mystifying waiting list, and the Greenhouse) are hit and miss. Better value to be had by packing your own picnic and enjoying it in the carefully cultivated acres.

ChIJr8AOrlCozR0R_-LZjMmV4vs.adr_address: 40 Main Street, Paarl, 7646, South Africa
ChIJr8AOrlCozR0R_-LZjMmV4vs.name: Wine Estate - Mason's Hill

reviews.text: The Wine is magnificent! The people are warm and welcoming! This is without a doubt the best Shiraz in the world!!!

ChIJI94Vg0PbzR0Re5bsTUzUU_U.adr_address: Valley Road, Elgin,, 89, 7180, South Africa
ChIJI94Vg0PbzR0Re5bsTUzUU_U.name: Charles Fox Cap Classique Wine Estate

reviews.text: Friendly and hospitable. Good bubbly. Beautiful tasting room and fantastic scenery.
Came here during a random weekend adventure. Really enjoyed learning about what they do. We had a personal tour through the cellars and an overall good time. The place offers great views!
Charles Fox is so friendly and down to earth. He let us roam around the cellar, explained the MCC process patiently and let us play with the cat, Harry Potter.

What a great surprise. Great quality vintage MDC "champagne". Charles Fox himself gave me a tour of his cellar. Not only was the champagne delicious but it was great to see that it was a family run business. Definitely a place I will continue to support.
Go for the cellar tour

ChIJnas91ZqvzR0RWrXvyIUzUc4.adr_address: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, 7680, Western Cape, South Africa, 7680, South Africa
ChIJnas91ZqvzR0RWrXvyIUzUc4.formatted_address: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, 7680, Western Cape, South Africa, 7680, South Africa
ChIJnas91ZqvzR0RWrXvyIUzUc4.name: Allee Bleue Wine Estate

reviews.text: Booked a family picnic and wow! What a lovely experience we had. When making the booking I informed them, we were celebrating a birthday, and they surprised us with a taste of their fine wine. That was really special. Our kids were entertained on the beautiful lawn and with the jungle gym. The food was amazing and the service excellent. Definitely a picnic venue for the whole family, but still elegant and very charming.
Nice place. Nothing over the top but ok wines.
Pretty farm. Fun place and not just for kidz!

ChIJnas91ZqvzR0RWrXvyIUzUc4.vicinity: Intersection R 45 and R310, Groot Drakenstein, 7680, Western Cape, South Africa

reviews.text:
After stopping at several larger, more commercial wineries, we happened upon Eikehof Wines just shy of their closing time, and they graciously agreed to let us do a wine tasting...and we're so glad it worked out!

We tasted some amazing wines including the best dessert wine I've ever had, we chatted away with the hostess and learned a lot from her about wine-farming, especially in light of the current drought in the Cape, and we felt welcomed. Overall it was an excellent experience and a highlight for our wine-tastings.

A warm, friendly atmosphere. In contrast to other wine farms in the area which were far more commercial in their approach, Eikehof offers the more family run, hospitable type of wine tasting experience.
Amazing, personable owners who take the time to chat, share their enthusiasm for wine making, and of course incredibly beautiful, smooth wines.
What is warmer than the current weather...Eikehof's hospitality! Thanks to Francois, Elize and Corna

Francois and his family make a visit to Eikehof a very special occasion.  In an age when most wine farms offer large commercial tasting rooms the personal touch in a marvelous setting is a breath of fresh air.

reviews.text: Beautiful views in the day with the vineyards and Table Mountain in the background and at night with the nightlights flowing into forever...  what a fantastic experience and excellent service! Thank you ALTYDLIG management and staffðŸ‘Œ
Awesum Wedding venue
Breathtaking view, awesome place
Birthday shoot

It is wonderful that we live in a city where you dont have to go far to experience nature, I passed a used condom and a knockout drunk guy before getting to my car this morning. It took me 30 minutes to go from that to the sound of doves cooing and peacocks calling over the vinyards. It is such a privillage to be able to go to places like this.

Too bad the serenity of the place was shattered by a man verbally attacking me for mistaking the dirt road to his property for the exit.  Maybe a private property sign will help?

ChIJXQPpg_lNzB0RQIWbGyEgNhE.vicinity: Langverwacht Road, Stellenbosch Farms, Cape Town

Very nice wine and cheese pairing. Definately coming back to spend more time here.
awesome setting. .. incredibly friendly staff... the wine is out of this world.  We will definitely be back. ..
Superb Location. Great Wines. Very friendly staff.
Lovely setting, great wine, coffee shop and restaurant. A quaint little gem.

ChIJiaLEiwutzR0RNPeOkuH1Fsk.vicinity: Off R44, Klapmuts Road, R44, Stellenbosch

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing food and wine. Setting is excellent even on a windy day. Owner is really polite and friendly. Best Mexican style food Iâ€™ve had in SA!!

Amazing setting that is very well thought out. The picnic basket for 2 is incredible value for money with a great blend of Mexican and traditional Cheeses with a fresh warm ciabatta. 

What made them really shine is though is an incredible 2015 Chardonnay, booking in advance that allowed them to impress us with extras at no charge and above all fantastic staff that bridges the gap between fine dining and a lovely Sunday by the dam. 

Exceptional.
Beautiful setting to try some fantastic wines.  Our host was very attentive and knowledgeable
Awesomeness as usual  bought as much as could fit into boot
Delicious food. Good service. Child friendly

ChIJkQ7yIjBozB0RnYeHPdgkawE.name: Eagles' Nest Wines

reviews.text: Waste of petrol. Such good scenery and such poor service and food. And if you driving and don't won't wine I suggest you sneak in your own soft drinks as this place only caitters for people that walk there.  Either that or promoting drinking and driving.

This is one of my good memory in South Africa. This is quiet on Monday morning. Two lovely couples and I were enjoying in the beautiful scene of this winery. The waiter's service is good and professional. They treated me well and present their wines clearly. I bought two bottles of their wine later. It is worthy to take a break in this fantasy place.
Lovely, relaxing. Great space for kids. Food variety limited. Wine tasty.

Situated in a beautiful treed valley off Constantia road with rolling lawns..picture perfect. Went for a wine tasting. The rain came and we had to squash into the entrance lounge. A pleasant experience which could have been greatly improved had the fireplace been crackling away with a fire. The outside seating also had no umbrellas erected.
Viognier, Rose and Merlot wines are great. Wonderful setting, and the food platters are perfect. Definitely recommended

ChIJkQ7yIjBozB0RnYeHPdgkawE.vicinity: Constantia Main Road, Constantia, Cape Town

ChIJoyhIS6WuzR0RH_4TAMTBSjw.adr_address: Klapmuts - Simondium Rd, Paarl, 7625, South Africa
ChIJoyhIS6WuzR0RH_4TAMTBSjw.formatted_address: Klapmuts - Simondium Rd, Paarl, 7625, South Africa
ChIJoyhIS6WuzR0RH_4TAMTBSjw.name: Backsberg Estate Cellars

reviews.text:
We enjoyed cappuccinos on the restaurant veranda overlooking the patio dining area in, which is in dappled shade surrounded by trees and shrubs. The indoors part of the restaurant has an old worldly feel even though it appears to be of modern construction. Our waitress recommended booking a table during the busy summer months.

The wine tasting room provides tasting at a counter standing, or seated indoors or outdoors. The staff member helping us is friendly and knowledgeable about the wines. Containers are provided to empty your glass into after tasting. Please do not drink and drive! Wines can be bought by the bottle or case and can be delivered.

The small garden is beautifully kept and in a perfect condition. Visitors are allowed to explore the garden. Do not miss the water feature!

A friend chose it and told me the burgers were amazing. Unfortunately not the case ,my Lamb burger was 2.5 pieces of Roast lamb slices,the beef burger that another in our group ordered tasted like, as he put put it "Frozen burger that you cook out the box" . I skipped dessert . If you're looking for a place to drink - yes. Feeling hungry ? Eat before you come so you aren't disappointed.

Visiting from Germany and doing an informal tasting at the counter with Mildred. She told us everything about the wines, the winery and the business. Also she convinced us of 6 different wines, One of them was a lovely red blend with Zinfandel which was quite surprising to find since we havent seen Zinfandel here in Cape Winelands at all. They have such a large variety of wines available, all wines we tasted were lovely and and it was a great and really fun wine tasting experience with Mildred. If you look for a relaxed down to earth Place with a Great tasting and delicious wines here you go.
Came here coz it is the reason I drink CabSav. And then I found that they do brandy too. Very nice Spanish feel that adds to the ambience of the visit
Great Sunday lunch under the oaks with good food and good wine and great people. Loved it!

ChIJ4ag-Ml-8zR0RTac9cdL07T0.adr_address: Excelsior Rd, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJ4ag-Ml-8zR0RTac9cdL07T0.name: La Bourgogne Winefarm

reviews.text: Always a great welcome and a great meal. Very good value for money.
Clean and practical accommodation with friendly staff. Very nice farm, perfect for a weekend getaway
Incredible place - donâ€™t miss the opportunity to go here ! Best place in  Franschheok !!

We loved our stay at the farm. The cottages were as warm and welcoming as Lauren herself. 
Be also aware of the dogs - you will fall in love.
They have the most delicious cheese platter!

ChIJO00iDk-7zR0Rbp2E0wSyJ5c.adr_address: R45, Franschhoek, Cape Town, 7690, South Africa
ChIJO00iDk-7zR0Rbp2E0wSyJ5c.formatted_address: R45, Franschhoek, Cape Town, 7690, South Africa

reviews.text: Congratulations Liam and team. I visited the restaurant at Maison Estate in January 2017 while it had another name and chef. It was extremely disappointing. I had dinner with friends a week ago and it was magnifique. The service, the attention to detail, the quality of food and the innovative menu was faultless. Well done ! .
A lovely stop over with that "on the farm " feeling with good food and wine. Lovely venue for weddings.
Awesome service. A very informative waiter. Delicious wines. A bit expensive, but worth a stop.
Wine and food pairing option for the true wine lover

Fantastic wines, great venue, not my style of food. Modern cuisine is definitely not on my list, but if you enjoy it, you will love this place. Very expensive if you are South African - aimed at foreign tourists.

Very nice place with an amazing view! We went there a Friday night as the place closes at 8pm. We really enjoyed the view. The wines are good. And the staff is welcoming. We had very interesting explanations.
The sauvignon blanc is my favourite.
Very nice wines with amazing views and lovely, knowledgeable staff. Great to get away from the huge wineries.
Great wine and beutiful farm

reviews.text:
Awesome little winery. Has fantastic views over the entire helderberg area including views looking up to Sir Lowry's Pass. The location at the foot of Sir Lowry's Pass is lovely and still close to Somerset West and Gordons Bay.

The wines are fantastic and the welcome is warm. Be sure to make a booking.
Absolutely gorgeous, fantastic wines and fabulous hosts that go the extra mile to make you feel special
Hidden gem with stunning wines!
Wonderful Place with a spectacular view and excellent wines from the young winemaker Yves! Stop over and convince yourself.

ChIJt5gVk3fJzR0RQ4ukl6dip7k.vicinity: 17 Old Sir Lowrys Pass Rd, Sir Lowry's Pass

reviews.text: Absolutely loved the wine tasting experience.  Gives u an opportunity to make an informed decision when purchasing wines. Service is excellent.
Stunning town in the heart of the Cape Winelands. Well worth a visit if you genuinely enjoy Cape Dutch architecture.
Excellent service, and very capable employees. Always willing to tell you where to go to experience the most of Stellenbosch.
Providing visitors with everything they need to know about Stellenbosch.
Wonderful must visit once in Cape Town

reviews.text: Relaxed vibe with great views and good service. This is a great place for brunch with tasty breakfast options, or have a beer tasting board with some tapas. Awesome place to hang out with a group of people.
Great venue. Pizzas from outside beer garden are some the best in CT
Great restaurant with beautiful views. We had a lovely breakfast here.
Went to the brewery here. Some good options, and pizza was also good. My wife buys olive oil here in bulk.
Stunning views and great vibes! The food looks amazing. Beer garden serves pizza only but even that was great. I hear there's live music and a dinner menu too on some days.
We had some very nice wines, and Niels was kind enough to sit down and try them with us. Cash is easier to pay with if you want to take a few home with you. They also have olive oil produced locally.
Great wine! Beautiful setting! Wine maker did our tasting himself. Highly recommended
A stunning wine farm that produces luscious, big reds and mesmerising, soft melon whites. Of the very best I have ever experienced.

So much fun with the owner/winemaker. Wish we could have brought back more. Saboteurs 
Together.
If you are in the area you have to visit - small scale wine farm at its best!

reviews.text: Wow!! Not only is the wine fantastic and of high standard, this time around we went to watch a show - Prime Circle. What an amazing setting and vibe. The amphitheater that is surrounded by trees makes it lovely to just sit and appreciate nature! What a wonderful day we had! See you soon!
Great atmosphere and friendly staff. The wine is also great
Awesome place to be at and even more so if you ride the trails.
Fantastic wine, wonderful hosts and lovely surroundings.

It was quite a nice surprise to find this wine farm on the road to Hermanus. Usually we just fly by, but on the day decided to pay them a visit. We were rewarded with a beautiful farm, warm service and great wines.

ChIJ7yyiyXvEzR0Rd8ji0RtTJBY.vicinity: Paul Cluver Estate Wines, N2, Kromco Turn off, De Rust Estate, Grabouw

I like this place

ChIJf6ORh2yyzR0RUs7KIktLVVs.formatted_address: Old Banhoek Road, Helshoogte Pass, Stellenbosch, Cape town, 7612, South Africa
ChIJf6ORh2yyzR0RUs7KIktLVVs.name: MolenVliet Oosthuizen Family Vineyards

reviews.text:
Came here for a friend's wedding. The location and the views were stunning. The wines also very good, although admittedly I don't really recall which ones we had. We just had A LOT.
The food after the wedding was very good.

I attended the wedding of a close friend in this family winery. It was one of the most special weddings Iâ€™ve ever been to. The landscape, the food, the wine, everything was absolutely perfect. And the service was beyond superb. Fantastic place

Stayed here for a close friend's wedding which was at the venue. Libby at the front destination was a star! 
Rooms are pricey but the setting is absolutely stunning, open your curtains in the morning to a perfect scene of pristine picturesque mountain ranges dwarfing everything else in view. Look down in front of you and gaze over the lush green Shiraz vineyards.
They are close to a Berry farm (other side of the valley) close to Stellenbosch (if you'd like to visit) else you have an array of vineyards in the vicinity.
NOTE: there are horse fields next door so there are lots of flies, but they do spray the building etc to control the situation.
Absolutely Fabulous.. .didn't want to leave. Definitely recommend it.
Fabulous service was excellent. It was an unforgettable experience

ChIJf6ORh2yyzR0RUs7KIktLVVs.vicinity: Old Banhoek Road, Helshoogte Pass, Stellenbosch, Cape town

ChIJqeXmbZTnzR0RWwh3whZwDXw.name: Beaumont Wines

reviews.text: Beautiful estate! My group just did a wine tasting but they refused to let us sit down, even though Iâ€™m pregnant. Many tables were open! So I sat by myself on a bench where they allowed me to- far away from my group. Wish they could have made a small exception for a pregnant lady just looking to enjoy the afternoon with family.

Had such a lovely experience at the wine estate.. The winemakers son even showed my daughter to the play area. The wines are amazing especially the 2016 Chenin Blanch Demi-Sec which I thoroughly enjoyed.. For more on my experience visit my instagram page @throughmywineglass
Nice wines, especially the white dessert one
Top quality wines great atmosphere would recomend a visit

Such a stunning place. Great trail for running. Beautiful scenery. Wine. And a very griendly family.
We hope to see you guys in the future again.

ChIJzws0T2C7zR0Rnw1eWS_ltv4.adr_address: Main Rd, Franschhoek, 7690, South Africa
ChIJzws0T2C7zR0Rnw1eWS_ltv4.name: Rickety Bridge Winery

reviews.text: Went for the wine tasting. Very welcoming, great wine, friendly people, beautiful place! The view is majestic as the property is situated on the side of a hill. A big selection of inexpensive wines. One of my favorite stops on our trip.

Very nice winery. They serve the biggest portions of wine during tasting. The server was wonderful. The place felt warm and homey. The scenery is not the best at this winery, but the wine, service, and environment are top notch.
Really nice food and great wine. I can recommend the pork belly.
Charles is the man here.He does  about everything and with style.To replace him will take a number of people.Good wine and excellent service.Also the cheapest on wine pairing in the region

Rickety Bridge is a beautiful wine estate just outside the town of Franschhoek, that sits picturesque in the Franschhoek Valley.

They have a talent to keep the old but mix it with modern design elements at both their estates as well as with their wines. Just look at the nicely designed labels.

They offer extreme cheap wine tastings which can be accompanied by great cheese platters etc. Staff at Rickety Bridge is extremely friendly and knowledgeable. When it comes to sales, they are not pushy at all but simply like to makes sure one has a great time.

Rickety Bridge Wine estate is also part of the green line Franschhoek Wine Tram. It's a convenient way to get there an experience it first hand!
No one to greet us on arrival, had to ring 3 times, no explanations of wines during tasting and messed up our order. However, scenery was beautiful!
Exelent

Excellent service! Food is nice! Beautiful views! Very friendly staff! Thank you for going extra mile for our birthday! We loved everything. 
I'd highly recommend your restaurant!!
Glen Carlos consistently gives warm and polite service, combined with exquisite meals and stunning views of the local wine valley.
Great wine and service. The views over the valley are hard to beat.
Amazing lunch. US client says possibly best lunch she's ever had!
Very professional and slick.  Really enjoyed our tasting.

ChIJ4xA8lGDizR0R8VxXeGj1ZIY.adr_address: Hemel & Aarde Rd R320, Hermanus, 7200, South Africa
ChIJ4xA8lGDizR0R8VxXeGj1ZIY.formatted_address: Hemel & Aarde Rd R320, Hermanus, 7200, South Africa
ChIJ4xA8lGDizR0R8VxXeGj1ZIY.name: Creation Wines

reviews.text: This lovely winery is offering great food and wine. As me and my boyfriend are vegan, we informed the restaurant in advance and they promised to create something for us. What we got in the end was an amazing and very creative three course menu, which we both enjoyed a lot. The restaurant and the outdoor sitting area are both beautiful, the views breathtaking.
Wonderful vibe, fantastic wines. Highly recommended! We especially loved the â€œArtâ€ Chardonnay. Thank you for a great day!

Ask for "the story" it is a delicious meal. We had a 7-course wine pairing lunch. Incredible wines with a top class variety of foods. Even though it was very busy, the host managed to come to our table and explain "the story" behind every dish and how it evolved since the beginning of the winery.
Still one of the best since farms I've been to & I've done a few... Highly recommended. Booking well in advance

If you would like to take visitors or friends to a lovely setting with arguably the best wine and food pairing course ever - look no further. In the fantastic 'hemel en aarde' valley we have the restaurant of creation wines. My partner and I have been replicating the cauliflower soup, the restaurant keeps all their dishes on their website!
This photo is my friend Rego expressing his joy after our experience.

ChIJk_QdjyC1zR0RWYGPeMtTtTE.adr_address: R44, Bel` Aire, Cape Town, 7135, South Africa
ChIJk_QdjyC1zR0RWYGPeMtTtTE.formatted_address: R44, Bel` Aire, Cape Town, 7135, South Africa
ChIJk_QdjyC1zR0RWYGPeMtTtTE.name: Wine Estate - Avontuur Wine Estate

reviews.text: This must be my favourite place. I recommend it to all.

ChIJF8y_791MzB0RmGpc6SI8yUc.adr_address: Spier Wine Farm,, R310, Stellenbosch, South Africa
ChIJF8y_791MzB0RmGpc6SI8yUc.formatted_address: Spier Wine Farm,, R310, Stellenbosch, South Africa
ChIJF8y_791MzB0RmGpc6SI8yUc.name: Spier Wine Tasting Centre

reviews.text:
Went for lunch and to see the raptor rescue habitat.  The lunch was very good; I had a chicken pie and the crust was perfectly flaky and the chicken was plentiful and well-seasoned.  I ordered a glass of their wine and enjoyed it.  The restaurant decor is very pretty but unique.  Hanging lamps are shaded with up-cycled plastic milk jugs--but you have to look closely to realize it.  
The raptor show was OK.  It's educational but the hands-on part wasn't all that exciting. The staff person was hard to hear as she kept turning her face away from the audience and there were children crying and talking which made it worse.  There are some owls, pigs and tortoises for children to touch.

This is definitely a must do activity whenever you are in Cape Town. Having a real farm experience with beautiful sceneries and seeing the animals. They have activities for kids as well. Wine tasting paired with chocolate is a real treat. Truly a customer oriented service you will get over here. Very nice facilities and the people that work here are super professional, they know what they are talking about.

Nice experience with awesome wine.
We took both the R40 and R90 tasting, both are fantastic - the R40 selection consist of good house wine and some good (and definitely more extensive) ones.
And got a very unique and great red wine from the R90 selection.
Totally worth it...

Allow Susan (out wine guide for the day) to guide you through this unbelievable experience of fine wine with a nice cozy atmosphere and a personal touch. All wines were enjoyable but the chocolate pairing was our favourite! A great first stop on your way around Stellenbosch.

Fantastic 
We had a super day, restaurant was excellent food unbelievable beef salad.
Walk with the hawks was super and the shows brilliant. Eagle encounter superb as well

ChIJZ7mPiDvbzR0REW2VrUCl5nc.adr_address: 76 Highlands Road, Elgin, Elgin, 7180, South Africa
ChIJZ7mPiDvbzR0REW2VrUCl5nc.formatted_address: 76 Highlands Road, Elgin, Elgin, 7180, South Africa

reviews.text: Excellent wines , the First Quantum Grand Reserve 2011 is sublime

I keep a very happy memory of my stay at Kyburg. Rosmarie and Fred both of Swiss origin are such warmhearted and wonderful hosts. The quality level of their wines is truly outstanding and I wish I could have stayed longer with them.
Ernst Maurer

reviews.text: What a great visit! The story wines were my favorite part of the wine tasting with a great hostess. Ask your host about the story on The Six Flowers  ðŸŒ¸ The tasting room superb, The gardens need an update and the restaurant caters for foreigners wallets
Great wines (especially the Malbec). Enjoyed the wine tasting a lot, weren't rushed. We just had the normal tasting but there is a wine and food pairing option which looked delicious.
From the unmistakable view as you drive down the pine lane, up to the fantastic wines we tasted with our charming hostess, this is a must see farm when you are in the area.

We went for a quick sundowner at the restaurant, but then discovered the Wednesday evening live music in the wine tasting rooms. What a pleasure. The music was great and so was the service. Their Owl Post wine is one of my all time favourites.
Sadly this farm was fairly average. Wine tasting experience was mediocre and not very informative. Was was OK but there are nicer farms to visit for a first Cape Visit

Great hospitality, polite staff, good food. The manor has a cosy patio on wich you can enjoy a homemade glass of wine with a beautiful view on the vines of their property. At sunset the mountains at the horizon color red-orange, wich takes your evening to another level.
Romantic,excellent location amazing high class chef,peaceful, go slow atmosphere ,bedroom very comfortable and spacious,clean throughout

Great place to visit! Good atmosphere and knowledgeable staff!!!
Stunning location ,  great wines, beautiful restaurant  will return to sample good looking food
Wines are ok, and food was quite good.  Place is beautiful and people are friendly.
A delightful wine farm in a stunningly beautiful setting. Restaurant opens in August and is well worth a visit.

reviews.text: A pleasant dining experience in a beautiful setting. Picking fruit from the plum and peach trees, exploring along a shallow stream, and a lovely outdoor playground kept our children entertained whilst we enjoyed our wine and pizza.
Beautiful setting. Great pizzas and absolutely great experience. Kids can play on the grass, jungle gym and lots of space.
Must go have the pizza and wine pairing. It is out of this world and the view and drive to the place is so so so beautiful. A good place to end off a wine tasting day
Difficult to find if you don't know the area but they have great wine and a great atmosphere ðŸ‘Œ
An amazing pizza and wine pairing. A nice and fresh venue in summer that has amazing food and wine.

reviews.text: Was unfortunately very disappointed in our service at Buitenverwachting. Arrived at 16:20 for a wine tasting (open for wine tasting until 17:00 according to signage). We waited quite a while before we were acknowledged, we then requested that we would like to complete a wine tasting, but was very rudely instructed that they do not do wine tastings at that time. We informed them that their signage clearly states that they are available until 17:00, our question was rudely ignored and it was stated that we can still buy wine to take home, we left the premises at this time with a bad taste in our mouths . I have had some of their wine before and was looking forward to taste their selection and purchase some bottles to take home. I would however not visit or purchase any wine for them in the future. All other places we visited we enjoyed excellent service after leaving Buitenverwachting

Fabulous food, excellent waiting staff and great atmosphere. Only complaint it that the food was served up too quickly after ordering and between courses. It all felt a little to rushed for my liking. Because of this they get a 3 instead of a 4.

I love this estate and restaurant but an fairly disappointed that in this day & age you do not get any vegetarian options as main courses. I ate there yesterday and had to have 2 starters as all the main courses are non vegetarian. The waitress informed me that the kitchen/chef could not make me a vegetarian main course. Will unfortunately not be returning unless this policy changes. I did enjoy the 2 starters and the setting is amazing. I sincerely hope the Chef changes his/her attitude towards vegetarian & possibly vegan cuisine and joins the progressive restaurants in Cape Town who offer multiple dishes that are not meat based. If there were vegetarian and vegan options then I would have given a 5 star rating.

Fantastic food. A very special place with a quiet and smooth atmosphere. The food is nothing but the best. Top notch staff. One of my favorite fine dining places in CT. Budget with around 800 pr person.
Beautiful, tranquil environment. Lovely breakfasts..only 3 options (but sometimes this is not a bad thing) & scones. You can picnic out on the grass..& kids have space to play, but no kids play area

ChIJg3mVCdtpzB0RGEaBR0FMr_o.vicinity: 37 Klein Constantia Road, Nova Constantia, Cape Town

Beautiful farm. Top wines.
Amazing wines!

Did the wine tasting. 3 reds and 1 white but they're open to a bit of change depending on the season. Expensive but worth the visit. Wanted to buy 1 each of the 4....ended up buying just 2 due to cost. Will definitely go back for another tasting. :)
Delicious food... beautiful views and great service! Will be back soon.

reviews.text: Oldenburg Vineyards is a family run winery that makes some of the best wines in the region. The large open tasting room has a gorgeous view out over the vineyards and the mountains. Itâ€™s worth coming for the scenery but itâ€™s really the vintages that will take your breath away.
Very peaceful and beautiful setting with a fantastic view of the Banhoek valley and mountains. Excellent wine also.
Beautiful scenery, great interior and exterior design at the facility.
Amazing view and excellent wines
Alles bestens immer wieder gern 1+++

Wir waren Ã¼ber mehrere Jahre auf Druck MY Niet. In diesem Jahr brannte leider das Weingut vÃ¶llig nieder. Der Besitzer hat sich um uns zu keiner Zeit gekÃ¼mmert, seine Versprechungen, unseren Schaden zu begleichen hat er dann revidiert. Uns hatte er noch erzÃ¤hlt, dass er aus dem Schaden Ã¼ber die Versicherung mit einem Plus herauskommen will. Nun wissen wir auch, wie er das machen wird.  Seine Versicherung teilte uns mit, dass sie nicht zahlen, weil es hÃ¶here Gewalt sei. So etwas Dummes habe ich noch nie gehÃ¶rt. Dazu muss man auch noch sagen, dass nicht er sich um die Kommunikation gekÃ¼mmert hat, sondern wir selber. Es poster aber seinen Urlaub aus einer der teuersten Destination um Kapstadt. Das ist eine VerhÃ¶hnung an seine GÃ¤ste.Mal sehen, wie lange seine Machenschaften erfolg haben....

reviews.text: ....On the day of our visit it Stormed but it did not dampen our enjoyment of the Chocolate & Wine Pairing session. Our host made us very comfortable at a floor to ceiling window, very private. And I believe that the rain did us good cause there were No flies around, HAHAHA! We even enjoy our Indoor Picnic with our supplied "Picnic Basket"! We recommend that all Chocolate & Wine lovers try this out at least once in a life time. We had an Awesome Indoor experience. ...This farm and venue is set a charming valley surrounded by lots of trees and a river even runs by it! The outside entertainment area is breathtaking-lii awesome big wooden building housing a large pub area with seating over looking the flowing stream!.....We will be back here in the future!.....
The staff are very friendly and the chocolate pairing was great
Skip this one. Average pizzas with little atmosphere and poor service. Flies and cheap cutlery didn't help. It's a pity though because their wines have potential.

Unfriendly people
Expensive wines.

reviews.text: We had a delicious lunch and enjoyed the beautiful views here! Such a great place for kids and very friendly staff.

The deck restaurant has very nice scenery and is great for a Sunday lunch.

The service wasn't really great. Our guy forgot our drinks a few times and we also had to get up and go inside to order stuff ourselves.

I order the pork belly which was very good, but still left an empty spot in my tummy. I feel that it just wasn't enough food for the amount of money that I had to pay for it. 

My wife had a Gourmet burger which was very good, I had to take a few bites from her to supplement my meal.
Friendly service and good knowledge of the wines. Excellent wines to be tasted, worth a visit.

Decent place to eat, given limited options on a Sunday. Lovely setting with deck overlooking pond with swans.
Menu a bit unimaginative.
Fantastic wines, unbelievable setting! Wonderful place to spend a few hours!

Lovely gardens and enjoyed the wine tasting. Our wine steward was particularly knowledgeable and generous with his time. Do try the Maestro White.
As a tour guide I think its just the best everything about it

ChIJlTiKIP-nzR0Rv8Bnp2iG5ro.name: Nederburg Wines (Pty) Ltd

reviews.text: One of the best wine estates in the country. Awesome to stroll around, relax and take pictures. Great selection of wines which are moderately priced. Super friendly and helpful staff. Cozy venue. Good for groups and couples. All around great experience, will certainly be back!
Good wine, wonderful price. We visited on a holiday so maybe did not get the best experience. Nice views.

We're people of "reds" so we have known and enjoyed Nederburg wines for a long time. Beautiful blends! 

We were the first visitors of that day :) Dropped in just from the airport. Lovely lady Annijika (please correct the spelling if wrong!) took us for a tour around the winery, showed the cellar and the production centre. Actually it was a private tour! We were so lucky! She gave a lot of detailed information about the company, wines, grapes, terroir, history, stories behind everyday hard work of the Team. Everything was very interesting and we learnt a lot of new things. The history behind today's success was long (226 years long!), sometimes painful.

The Winery and the Team along with the Leaders and the Creators at the top are highly deserve all the World' and local rewards and admiration around the Globe!

After the informational tour we had a wine tasting. Of course we preferred their reds but it was amazing to taste some of their whites - we ended up with purchasing some bottles for home :)

Great wines! Amazing people behind! 
Keep on shinning brightly! 

Cheers! :)

An early start for the day, we travelled for an hour plus to arrive at Nederburg Wines, one of the older vineyards in Stellenbosch.  For a wine drinker like me, the professionally presented wine tasting session in the impressive ambiance was fantastic. A total of 6 types of wine we tasted, if you ask me to verbalize the tastes and aromas, I have to be honest. I don't know. Still, one thing is certain. I can differentiate between white wine and red wine, well, from the colour. Pretty much a simple thing, I am sure even a non-wine drinker obviously can do that as well. Okay, wine is also ultimately my comfort during weekends to relax prior to tucking into bed.    

At Nederburg Wines, kicked off with wine tasting, we then toured the huge farm winery to understand a thing or two on wine-making process, returned to the foyer to purchase some wine and before leaving, we walked around the wine plantation to marvel at the beautiful sight of the grape varieties.
Beautiful setting, beautiful manor house, amazing food and service. Fully recommend The Red Table restaurant.

reviews.text: Would not recommend if you don't have a reservation, we didn't have a reservation but you do still have the option to picnic on the grass, as we were about to order a bottle of wine at the bar a kind waiter was about to assist us when the bartender abruptly and gently pushed him aside and referenced him to a table on the floor. We sat there another 5 minutes before being helped, which didn't bother us at all. But a little courtesy comes a far way in the hospitality industry. Did buy a bottle and enjoyed a short stay.

The restaurant is a beautiful venue with some amazing views of the Constantia wine farms. I suggest making a reservation in order to get a nicer table but you can also picnic on the grass if there isn't any space. Service is a bit slow, it seems they're a bit understaffed, as we only had one waiter for quite a number of tables. We waited quite long for cutlery and for the second half of our wine tasting and had to ask a few times before we would get anything. Wines are very good though and the waiting staff know a lot about their wines.

What an incredible venue! Great atmosphere with a picturesque view. Very few tourists, it seems a place where locals can enjoy a great tasting wine looking over the vineyards. 
Definitely a must go in Cape Town

Nice place for wine tasting. Josh was our host, good fun and knowledgeable about the wine, the vineyards and the area. Lovely views and lovely environment. Many different options for wine tasting which was nice and bought a bottle of our favourite one...
Top Location.  Nice Views. Lovely Wines

reviews.text: Best wine tasting experience I've ever had. Staff are very friendly. Well recommended.
Huge selection of wines. Very popular with tour groups so it can get noisy/busy. For this reason, booking for tastings are advised.
Thelma wines yes!!!yes!!!! Great wines the people doing the tastings are giving the wine the character of wowðŸ˜‰ðŸ˜‰

Crescenda Willemse hosted us for a very fine wine tasting. She is a most personable and accomplished  lady, and made our visit so much more enjoyable.

We have been to many wineries and done the usual "tasting bit", but this was very special and excellently done - thanks in the main to Crescenda.

The wines are also top quality, and it is well worth a visit ,as it is a a lovely setting.
Free tasting, great wines. Highly recommended!

Worth the drive to see this great vineyard!

Seriously? This vineyard was supposed to be amazing. After taking a dirt road you will see the domain to the right. The staff doesn't seem to care, we asked them to start over the wine tasting as the white wines were warm... None of their wines tasted any good to our palates, the six of us left quickly, disappointed...
Beautiful setting in a valley surrounded by mountains. Lovely wines, great aroma and taste. My favourite is Chardonnay with an oak flavour. Great tasting experience.
Beautiful setting, excellent cheeseboard and unwooded Chardonnay really good

reviews.text: First stop with wineflies wine tours... awesome tasting... fantastic wine!
Easily one of the nicest and most personal Wine Estates. Wonderful wines, great tasting and the friendliest owners you can imagine. Also, a great place to stay in their fabulous pool house.

I would like to thank Karin and her hubby for having us.  We had an amazing time at Mitres Edge for our wedding anniversary.  The wine is awesome.  The accommodation is fully kitted, neat, clean and stocked with a whole bunch of activities from cards to a pool table to a Jacuzzi.  Karin and husband is very friendly and We will definitely be back.  Thank you guys.
Fantastic wine tasting. Met new people made new friends. Thank you it was awesome. Will be back

We had a fantastic stay at Mitre's Edge at their luxurious pool house. The accommodation is very well appointed, with everything from a pool table to a jacuzzi and sauna for our sole use. The location is perfect for a weekend exploring Paarl and Simondium. The owners made us feel very welcome and the wine produced on the farm is excellent! We'll definitely be back.

reviews.text: Fantastic setting, advise a booking in advance to avoid dissapointment during holiday season. Certainly focused on upmarket clientel, but if you enjoy good service, a good place to come and enjoy their wines and good food.
Wine Tasting at Guardian Peak. Beautiful view of Hidden Valley. Great atmophere. Good wine. A must.

What a gem! The food was exquisite, modestly priced.  The restaurant is chilled and not pretentious, loved that.  The wine is great!  I have never been a fan of Shiraz but we ended up buying a bottle (among many other bottles), it's so tasty!  The view is just gorgeous!  The service was perfect, our waiter really made us feel comfortable and he knew his stuff, super cool guy.  It's just what we wanted to do on our anniversary.  Thanks so much Nick and your amazing team!
Fantastic evening. Great view, wine & food!
Top service. Excellent food. Very enjoyable evening.

reviews.text: The home of the Chocolate Block. We found this wine estate to be very hospitable. It's a bit out of the way but well worth a visit.

This farm is truly a hidden gem - their newly installed walk way through the forest that surrounds it, is absolutely amazing (with sculptures of Red Wolves - from the Wolf Trap brand placed well in between the foliage). It really is a lovely farm to spend an afternoon at. Walk around, drink wine, breath in the fresh air.
Great staff, good variety of wine, likes most but didn't *love* any one

Excellent. Ordered a 600g rump steak, medium rare. My knife glided through the steak like i was cutting through soft butter. 

The steak was well prepared with the fat grilled to perfection. A basting sauce accompanied the steak and was fresh and flavorful. A bunch of small baked potatoes in a rosemary, garlic and butter sauce complimented the steak really well. 

The maitre d' Charleston took interest in my meal making good meal suggestions and often enough followed up asking if i needed anything, yet not so much so to bother me. He was clearly aware of his patrons. I'll be coming back.
Best restaurant great service with a breath taking veiw of Cape Town

Just a great place, every time I do a wine tour, I always recommend it to my clients. Specializes in vintage wine ðŸ· must visit in stellenbosch.

Stayed in chestnut cottage, a smaller house than the one we stayed in previously. It is a simple place that is ideal for a couple. Situated by the Franschhoek river some of the best views of the valley are visible from the bathroom(?). Minor criticism: bedroom and closet doors need oiling - sneaking in/out of our room when putting our child down proved difficult. Other than that, highly recommended, especially in summer when the pool can be enjoyed.
great 2 days stay in the spectacular franschhoek valley. Beautiful cottages, amazing pool in the old pear orchards, really would recommend anyone staying in Franschhoek to book with Richard or Julie!

reviews.text: Bon Amis almost has it all. We ordered mussels (which were delicious but rich), seared salmon with wasabi potatoes (interesting flavor combination which worked well), a chicken pie with sweet potato fritters (one of the best I've had, although the bowl was impractical), and a Baked Alaska for dessert (impeccable). The food came out quickly and it was well-prepared at a reasonable price. BUT: there were a lot of families with small children and as a result it was very noisy, to the extent that I couldn't hear my fellow diners at our table. But in spite of the noise level, it was still a nice experience, and we might be back.
Not bad but food is way too expensive and service a bit slow. Medium rare steak was burnt and Ceasar salad was sub par...most expensive bowl of Cos lettuce ever. Enjoyed the house beer.
Great venue. We had our work Christmas function there & the atmosphere was fantastic. Food was good! We really enjoyed ourselves!

Had lunch there to celebrate 9 year wedding anniversary. Food was amazing! I called ahead to book table and order food, so it was ready within 5 mins when we arrived and hubby could get back to the office promptly and with a happy belly :)
I enjoyed my time there very much. Great for families with kids and the food was very good. Beautiful place

reviews.text: The most beautiful views of the vines, mountain range and sea. The market on Thursday's has great food and beer. I also went for a wine tasting(not on a Thursday) which was a little bit disappointing as the staff looked surprised and confused as to what to offer us as we were a group of 12. There were only two other small groups of people but the service was still slow. I would recommend the market on a Thursday and remember to get there early as it gets packed quickly.

We've attended the Thursday Food market and really enjoyed it. Beautiful setting with great food to choose from. Remember to get there early if you want a bench/seat but more than enough picnic place.

I attended the Thursday evening Food Market. Simply amazing foods and a wide selection. Make sure you have snapscan installed or enough cash because we ended up tasting a lot of different things. Drinks were reasonably priced. The place was packed and the atmosphere lively and engaging.

Old years eve Function disappointment!  I ONLY received a plate of chips for my R700 VIP ticket booked on 17 December with vegetarian, gluten-intolerant request. No other food was brought to our table.  I was told I could eat the chilli bites from the other 4 diners platter, as this was gluten free.  My friend bought a plate of fish and chips.  The batter had fallen off the fish and was returned.  The cheapest wine was over R200 a bottle. The French DJ was good but the only time he spoke was to ask the bar to assist them with their drinks order!  Paying guests on the lawn were left to find place on the dance floor, as no tent was provided in case of rain.  3 calls to the restaurant prior to this publication were ignored. Such insults and to be called a liar is unthinkable!  Although your restaurant does not cater for gluten-free meals, this was requested well in advance.  We went home early and ate our own snacks at home! I would not recommended this restaurant for any function!
Lovely place. The market on Thursdays is fantastic. And a good play ground for kids.

From the claying shooting range which, be it a fun activity, they BANG! could have just moved somewhere else on the premises. Atleast they waiting staff were friendly.

reviews.text: Picnics are good. Setting was great! Will be back again.

Stellenrust Wine Estate is a small but high-quality wine producer in the Golden Triangle of Stellenbosch, just in the back of Cape Town, established in 1928. One of its characteristic is to grow very old vines also more that seventy years old so its wine are very rich od flavour. The wine testing area is a very pleasant place to stay in almost every season of the year.
I love from this Wine Estate the Sauvignon and Chenin Blank barrel, the shiraz and their â€œmiracleâ€ â€¦ the TIMELESS.

Stellrenrust has great wines at a reasonable price. The tasting room and outdoor space are lovely and you have majestic views of the nearby mountains. Heinrich, who poured our tasting wines, is incredibly knowledgeable about the wines and so pleasant. Their chenin blanc wines are renowned but they also have great reds from their Shiraz, picalot, pinotage, cabernet franc and others. Their MCC is definitely worth buying. We loved their entire range of wines. The winery also has a huge room that would be great for a wedding or party.  The only downside to the winery is that your car will be covered with dust from the short 2 km drive on a dirt road but don't let this stop you from visiting.
Beautiful place, road abit Road for entry recommend don't take a low car or new car might get damaged, place nicely setup plenty of parking
Beautiful farm and area. Easy enough to find with google maps. Requires a bit off-roading. Pairing wasn't the best and I couldn't fully understand the reasoning behind some of the pairings.

reviews.text: Whenever you walk out of a tasting room feeling worse than you did walking in, you know there is a problem. DO NOT show up without a reservation. Even for the Signature Tasting (the website does not explicitly indicate that one is needed). Could have done without the condescension and should have ended an otherwise amazing day at another wine farm. Only spent a fraction of my intended budget, so at least my bank manager is happy. Giving it a 2 star, since there was a short, coloured lady who greeted us with a smile at the door and  tried to make us feel welcome by offering us some water.
I'm a guide who shamelessly uses his guests to explore wine, and this is my favourite so far. Book well in advance, and give yourself time to wonder around the gardens

This is really special wine. You can tell how much thought goes in to every bottle and it shows. The terroir range compares the same grapes and winemaking styles across different soils. Very complex while at the same time drinkable. All the grapes are grown in organic and sustainable ways. 
Had fantastic experiences both in riebeek (which you have to prebook and can only go on fridays if they're available) and at the franschhoek tasting room (also booking essential). Yes it is more expensive than some of the other area wines, but it is worth it for the brilliant flavors and you are supporting real visionary winemakers with commitment to the land and people.

Exorbitantly priced at R110 each for 4 tiny tastings. Price could easily have been justified by a wine of superior quality , but we did however notice a distinct soapy aftertaste to every wine. This message was relayed to the taste assistant but was dismissed without any comment. An additional soapy chardonnay was offered (which was thought to be complimentary) only to find out after that one single tiny tasting extra is priced at R60 each.
Between the inferior wine and the ridiculous prices it was an all-in-all unpleasant experience.
Incredible wines in an amazing setting . Booking essential though .

ChIJfbjnAvwhzR0RvqdpfcvQocI.vicinity: Leeu Estates, Dassenberg Road, Franschhoek, Cape Town

reviews.text: Great wine estate to visit for tastings or a lovely, light lunch. It's also the best wine in Wellington, in my opinion. Magnificent, peaceful setting makes you feel like you're the last people left on earth! Do be aware of the long, bumpy dirt road though.
The biggest hidden Gem. Surrounded by beauty. Great staff. Great food. Brilliant Wine.
One of the best wine farms I have visited. I enjoyed the wine they had to offer for tasting and was reasonable priced. A definite must visit.

Set in a picture perfect valley,  this wine farm is a must visit. We enjoyed a picnic next to the river that was absolutely delicious. Last 2.3 km to farm is on a pretty bumpy gravel so 4x4 is advised but not necessity. This place is totally worth the effort.
Beautiful wine estate and really nice wine tasting - great wines and service.

reviews.text: Lovely wine estate with a beautiful restaurant. Wines are reasonably priced and very good. The venue is gorgeous, but the gift shop is expensive. Well worth a visit.

A wonderful experience
We attended the Food and wine pairing session on New year's day 2016. It was fantastic!!! Firstly this is a great venue, absolutely stunning! Wouter and Peter were very knowledagle. I would highly recommend this session if you want to learn about the awesome wines and eat great food!
Beautiful modern building and grounds with an excellent buffet. However, they can be slightly frugal with replenishing the buffet, so go early to get a good idea of what is on offer!

Most disappointing wine farm I've seen in the area and we've seen quite a few.
Of course you can debate on taste when it comes to interior design, but I don't like the setup at all. Wide open space, that made me think of a school canteen. The weather wasn't nice, so of course the glass wall to the gardens was closed. I assume it's better with beautiful weather.
The food is a buffet and reasonable quality, however highly overpriced. The concept is salad as a buffet and a meat of your choice. We however didn't feel like having meat that day and then the salad alone is very expensive.
To me it feels like the place was designed to be able to handle high numbers of guests in a short period of time, unfortunately nothing cosy about that.

reviews.text:
Old country farm house seemingly in the middle of nowhere. Good, authentic food at Hilda's Kitchen, and equally good wine from the farm. Unique place, no hipsters.

Only gripe is the music they play over a small crappy little CD player, quite close to the table we sat at. I kept turning the volume down.

It's beginning to get expensive, country fair at city prices.
Great afternoon. Really good restaurant but you need to book

Let me start with the wines. If I were rating the wine and location in isolation, I would give it 5 stars. I have loved this estate for many many years. The original Groote Post Chardonnay is a beaut. 

We were helped today at the tasting room by Anthony. We arrived at 16:11 and were told we don't have much time as it is closing at 16:15. The website shows the tasting closes at 17:00. He rushed us from the outset and poured the first tasting without consultation about what we would prefer. He mentioned more than once that there was not much time. He rushed us through several glasses and it was a real turn off. 

I really like the wines, the area and the estate is also beautiful. I had hoped to enjoy the long awaited visit.

We first went for the free wine tasting and invest in their Unwooden Chardonnay and Savignon Blanc.  Thereafter we enjoyed lunch which was Pork Belly and Lamb Bunny Chow. Both were excellently prepared and tasteful. It's a bit off the high way, but worth the trip.

A bit out of the way, but absolutely worth the drive. Wonderful wines, the tasting is free, one of the oldest homesteads in South Africa, very rich history. We liked the quaggas on the farm - wonderful to see a formerly extinct species alive and well. As if all of this is not enough, everyone on the farm was so friendly and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Highly recommended!
The open air part is glorious; the views are phenomenal. The indoors rather underwhelming. The wines excellent!
One of my favourite wineries in the area. Location is superb, and the views alone are worth the visit!
Great view. But unfortunataly that was it. Aweful service and wine was the worst I ever had. Had my hopes up high, but this place turned out to be very disapointing.
One of the best views over the valley, this was a great place to grab a glass of wine while doing some afternoon writing.
location and view were great but the service was not very good! i personally didn't like the wine... and i thought for a wine tasting experience you'd get a new glass for each wineðŸ¤·â€â™€ï¸

My family has visited this farm and its beautiful  nature reserve several times over the years and we have stayed in the 100-year-old farmhouse and the newer cottages. All the accommodation on offer is comfortable, spacious and thoughtfully furnished. Although this is a working farm, as a guest one gets to experience it as a place of peace and tranquillity and we always leave it sad but rejuvenated.
Johan and Diana are exceptional hosts and nothing is too much trouble for them. The food and wine are in a class of their own and itâ€™s worth taking a drive out just to try them. The road up to the farm is absolutely no different from other farm roads and overall it is hard to believe that such a haven exists only an hour from Cape Town.

A beautiful piece of paradise just an hour away from Cape Town! Fynbos Estate is an incredible place for a country wedding (loved every second of ours) and the perfect spot for a quiet getaway to enjoy mountain walks, delicious food, wine tasting (and roaring fires in the winter). Just spectacular!

Perhaps the best-kept secret in the Western Cape, Fynbos Estate is a truly idyllic place, and one to which, over the years, we have returned again and again. What's more, it's just an hour out of Cape Town, easy to find, and the road is excellent the entire way â€“ the more so since the very short, untarred, final section has been upgraded. The farm â€“ which encompasses a mountain nature reserve â€“ has extraordinary natural beauty, the accommodation is aesthetically (and comfortably) designed, everything is spotlessly maintained, and Diana and Johan are wonderfully warm and welcoming hosts. Those who want to be fully catered for should know that Johan is a master chef, and a winemaker of exceptional talent: his 'natural' Dragonridge wines are simply superb.
Nice venue but very far out and dangerous roads. In fact, I rolled my car on the loose gravel upon leaving
Fast becoming my favorite wedding venue.

We especially enjoyed the great cappuccino in front of the cozy fireplace! The farm itself is beautiful and we explored a little on our own. Very creative wedding venue with a quaint little church on top of a hill overlooking Tulbagh.
Great wines at good prices.  The young lady was extremely knowledgeable and informative.  I remember drinking Theuniskraal Riesling in the 1960's. It is still a superb Riesling.

Very informative young lady. Good history of the vineyard and wines. Tasting is free unlike some other places in the valley. The rose is the best in the district light fruity easy on the palate. I have visited this vineyard for the past 3 years and always found staff friendly.

This is really a nice a farm to spend most of our time here. You can always feel save to put your kinds on the tractor ðŸšœ, (real reason why we always go there),  but even the wine is beter. Thanks alot to the management of Theuniskraal. We love your farm.

reviews.text:
Executed in classic style and still managed by the legendary Mr Prop Lategan, who also still pilots his powerful Cessna 210 aircraft, Bergsig is a must-visit. 

Wines are excellent, food includes traditional cooking to blend in with a historical setting. 

A tasteful presentation in so many ways.

We bought a selection of excellent wines at really great prices. Also, green fig jam, ripe fig jam, etc. I'd return there in a wink and won't easily tire. Staff were professional yet treated us so well that we truly felt at home.

Horrible service! Waited over a hour for our cold stale food. When we wanted to leave the card machine was broken so we could not pay and had to agree to eft them later. When we got to the parking lot we spoke to the only other party that was in the restaurant with us and their experience was the same. The one lady even got sick from the food! 

Would not recommend! This is not a restaurant. Its barely a wine sales office.

The wine is delicious, but arriving at 15:45 on a Saturday with ample time to taste wine we were informed that it closes at 4pm (and NOT 5 pm) as in Google. It was an unpleasant rush. PLEASE rectify your times so that people do not drive vast distances to attempt to eat/ drink at a place which is NOT actual available. (It is irrelevant that you have 9 am - 4 pm on your board in front of the farm).
Wine tasting was excellent....good wines!
Terrible service. Very slow.

ChIJ1x2aj8EGzR0Rb-9tpMUzqeM.adr_address: Noord Agter Paarl Road, Paarl, 7620, South Africa

reviews.text:
One of our favourite local spots. Lovely setting; consistently good food and service from great staff. Very good and well-priced wines from the estate. 
Our only complaints are as follows: the owner never gets up from behind his desk to greet his patrons or inquire about their experience; he only offers one type of pasta (penne) - which for an Italian restaurant is mildly irritating; and the seating offered outside should be more comfortable. We absolutely HATE benches with no backrests! Those were fine in student days..... 
With regard to this - they also have a very strange policy of not taking bookings for the inside of the restaurant. We often prefer to sit inside in summer, due to the more comfortable seating, or because of bad wind outside.
However, they generally won't allow bookings because they prefer to keep the inside seating for those who've booked for outside and need to move in due to bad weather conditions. We have arrived on occasion, on the spur of the moment, when they are full outside, but empty inside - and they have turned us away because of this policy! 
As a result, we do not go there nearly as often anymore.

Did not know of this place till we were invited today, and I was completely blown away! I drove all the way out of Bellville and it was well worth it. The staff os very friendly and assisted our table well and they kept us well informed. The pizza was the highlight of the evening. I have had many pizza's but ill drive all the way out for more of your Pizza's!! Well done Under Oaks
Best pizzas in the Boland, best friendly service, great wine at cellar door prices and above all a child friendly rural venue.
Very relaxed, great view, kind service. Been there multiple times and I still enjoy it.

reviews.text: Gracious and warm, the Bosman family run a beautiful farm (vine nursery and wine business). 8 generations have worked the land, and in recent years, under winemaker Corlea Fourie, they have produced some exceptional wines. Never shy to experiment, expect more great things from this estate.
Their warmth and hospitality, as well as the care for their labourers, are just so heart-warming. And their Cabernet is out of this world! Always a treat to visit.
Ask to see the winemakers private collection in the cellar underground, impressive!
They care about their people!

reviews.text: If you're looking for a real getaway, go here. Two nights over there and my bones feel like rubber... I'm that relaxed. It's beautiful and the owners embody the spirit of this welcoming estate. My advice... Go!

This place was very nice especially for the price. It is run by a kind and helpful family and the cottage we got was well equipped. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a getaway in wine country.
Beautiful scenery, birdsong, very caring and friendly hosts. Superb wines. What more do you want?

Beautiful scenery, accommodation was amazing and very comfortable. Lots of space to explore and the hosts were really friendly and looked after us well. We did the tractor ride to the top of the mountain with snacks and wine tasting, such a nice change from city living. Great for big groups and families
nice place but still under development

Awesome food, awesome staff, awesome for kids

It's a very beautiful place, but in my opinion it's too pricy. They've got it all to make it fantastic, but the service was poor during my stay here and there were small irritations like:
-check in was 20 minutes late
-the dstv in the room didn't work
-the tv remote didn't work
-Every time our neighbor opened the hot water tap our lights dimmed for a second
-the soap dispenser was broken
-service at the restaurant was very poor at breakfast
My stay was the night of 1 January, so it might be that the staff really just let them down.

reviews.text: Great golf course. Absolutely breath taking setting. Plenty of wild life roams the course. Course still in top shape in spite of the drought.
Immaculate place. Staff are professional, courteous and welcoming right from the staff. Restaurant has good prices on decent size meals. Relaxing atmosphere and views. Bathrooms modern and clean.

Situated on one of the popular Cape wine routes, the golf course is meticulously maintained and operated, 

Situated on a well known wine estate of the same name, some challenging holes and it is an easily walked course for those of average fitness. 

There is conference facilities and good accommodation available at reasonable prices, a secure facility.
Stayed overnight and one day for a business function. Lovely rooms and the food was good.
wonderful nights stay in the hotel. would recommend taking a trip there. the restaurant is amazing, pity i couldn't golf a quick 9 holes but it looked amazing

reviews.text: Now this is a lovely place. The food here is good. The wine is amazing. The views are stunning. I really don't have any complaints. Well worth the visit. Have some food, taste some wine. Buy a few bottles for the memories. You won't regret it.

What a fantastic little gem. They make the most amazing pulled pork burgers try it with the sweet potato fries. They compliment each other superbly. Enjoyed the stunning views. Staff are friendly and they think out the box and go the extra mile in customer satisfaction. We will be back!

Exquisite setting in nature, especially when enjoying a romantic meal on the balcony on a sunny day. Peaceful, relaxing, inspiring views. Great way to enjoy your meal or just expose your soul to the raw beauty of nature.
Had an excellent tasting session.  Veggie burger and sweet potatoe fries highly recommended

We went for a wine tasting: Beautiful setting, enjoyable wines and very friendly staff. Buy their new red blend- worth it. 

Ambiance: Typical wine tasting vibe. The restaurant is a bistro, only has a few options and is expensive but always busy. Book in advance. Fine to only have coffee and dessert. 

Food: We only did a wine tasting.

Service: Very friendly staff and good service.

Improvement suggestion: Seating for wine tasting. 

Compliment/ Best Feature: Their new red blend- a very affordable and enjoyable wine, buy some and get the recipe for a great sangria! 

Dog-friendly: No

a birthday brunch with wines thatâ€™s not available in any local stores! Wines are superb and the platters are scrumptious with enough cheeses to feed an army! reviews.text: Lovely food. Great wine. Stunning experience

My husband and I went to lunch here during last week.The place was very neat and clean.There were 4 outside tables under umbrellas with two of them occupied.We asked to sit outside but were told that the outside was only for serving of cheese platters and had to sit inside for lunch.We found this odd as there were no other clients inside and the view is minimal and we found it to be a bit gloomy.Nevertheless we were seated inside and were served quickly and efficiently.My husband had the pork belly and I has the kudu loin off a set menu.Both dishes were arranged beautifully and were  tasty,however my kudu loin was welldone and not medium as indicated on the menu.The prices are reasonable and the surrounding icluding the restrooms are neat and clean.There is also a winetasting area for those so inclined.
The service was good the food amazing. The venue clean and well kept. I would not go back in a hurry if it was not for the amazing food. Full of flavour and definitely something to write home about.
Very nice and elegant, but not recommened for families with small children.
The food is lovely - French toast to die for! Great setting as well.

reviews.text:
The vineyard is lovely, and not too busy or commercialised either. Their wine and cellars are great. The restaurant has delicious food, albeit a little pricey. Very friendly staff. The drive there is also beautiful. 
Call ahead to book a cupcake and wine tasting - you can't request it on the day!
Love this place! Did wine tasting under the watchful eye of the Spider window with an exceptional host. Loved it so much went back for lunch later in the week. Superb and highly recommend

It takes a long time to get here and there are plenty of wine farms on the way. After a lengthy drive, we found it was a charming place with variety. There are plenty of good wines and is a lovely to go to with a group of people. It's not too crowded and it's very serene! 
There are cupcakes for kids and even a cute dog walking around. Make your way and you will be charmed!

Have seen around 10 vineyards in the region, delheim was by far the best. Staff, food and the atmosphere was fantastic. Make sure to sit outside, you might have to order some food to do so. 

It was my third time to visit this place and I was never disappointed. 

Best wishes from Germany, see you next year :)

Most beautiful view and stunning vibe you get from staff and just walking throug the gardens on their pathways. Wine selection is very good, they have something for everyone. I prefer the cupcake-and-wine selection.

Beds and pillows were average. 

Breakfast and staff were great. 

It had potential to be great with a little more detail.

Beautiful place. The garden house restaurant staff was super friendly and the food was superb. The plants, herbs, flowers and tortoises make this place a must visit.

Great day out for the runners. Nice restaurant. Beer selection. Great place for families with kids.

We ventured out to climb Klapmutskop on a hot day, it was a beautiful hike with stunning views. The only negative was that they were spraying the vineyards on that day. The free coffee that comes with the permit was delicious.

If you are an active person and enjoy the outdoors Delvera is always a great place to go.  Great hiking and MTB  trails.  Restaurant  on site, wonderful micro brewery #Zebonkey , wine  tastings  etc.  You can make it day at Delvera.

We went to Delvera for the Wine Walk to Warwick. The Estate has quite a lot to offer - hiked and cycling but there is also a beer brewery, kids play area (with peddle go karts), pottery place with beautiful ceramics and so much more. Previously we visited for breakfast - and this time round we did the walk and had lunch at the Dirtopia Cafe. Great place with loads of parking.

We had a weekend here one year after our first visit and the same issues that we complained about last are exactly the same.

Dstv does not work
Shower floods the bathroom as the drain is clogged
The fridge and nothing in the kitchen worked this time.
There was even dirty coffee strainers that previous people left in the kitchen.

Last time the drinks in the fridge was past use by date and the cans even rusted.

We were planning on coming here every year, but with dissatisfaction two years in a row and no noticeable improvement, clearly they don't want to keep their clients!

Its not as if the accommodation is cheap either!

Yummy.

reviews.text: Fantastic way to visit the wine farms in beautiful Franshhoek. The purple line route is very popular. Transport is well co-ordinated and if you do get left behind or are a little late the staff always make a plan to get you to the next place. A beautiful experience indeed!

This simply a must do item for all visitors to Franschoek. There are several routes to choose from. All are good to be honest. Most wine-farms offer tastings, food/wine pairing etc. We did one where wines and chocolates were paired and we simply loved it.

The tram is beautiful and well kept, albeit small! We were only on the tram for a half hour, before getting into busses that took us from one wine farm to the next. Our package only included the tram and bus fees. We had to pay for each tasting along the way. It quickly becomes quite an expensive experience for locals.

This sweet little tram takes you to one of the wine farms in winter, maybe it goes further in summer. It's a great experience, especially if you have kids. Everyone is happy and it's a great way to see the scenery of all the vines.

This was a great experience, easy to book and the staff were friendly and very accommodating. The only thing that I didn't particularly like was the time limit at each wine farm. We felt very rushed. It's should've been at least an hour and 30 min,

reviews.text:
Graham Beck Wine Estate is located in the Robertson Wine Valley, 130 km on the left of Stellenbosch Wine Area and the different soil composition change the wine taste here in an unique way. The wine estate was several times rewarded and he for different wines 5 stars Platter. Anyhow wine is matter of personal taste, what I love is their MCC, The Ridge (probably the best shiraz I never had) and Pheasants' Run (a lovely Sauvignon Blank).
The wine tasting area and garden all around are treated impeccably, definitively a place to go.
This place is one of my favorite visits... Blanc de blancs is above anything else

It was surprisingly a great experience.
 
They have two tasting options â€“ Complimentary and a R75 option which includes three premium cap classique. The tasting fee is waived if you buy a bottle of any of their cap classique.
 
The atmosphere is very relaxed with their leather couches and aircon for the hot summery days. The cap classique is also reasonably priced and tastes delicious.
Great bubbly tasting experience with a beautiful view. ðŸ¾ Ended up buying a bottle on a women's month special at a great price

Modern tasting room with beautiful views over vines and distant mountains.  Speciality is sparkling wine made using MCC.  Large variety with some expensive varieties, but entry-level Brut NV is my favourite. Tasting and sales only.
