reviews.text: We spent two nights in one of their flatlets while attending a wedding. The food that was served at the wedding was tasteless, unimaginative and really dry. In the flatlet, our TV remote didn't work, so we couldn't switch over to AV to watch cable TV, the mattress should be replaced with something other than a sponge mattress which shrinks to about 5cm thick when you lie down, and the shower floor was black and sticky and we had warm water for about 1min as we had to share a geaser with our next door neighbours. Also, the guest wifi doesn't reach most of the guest rooms, which is really useless in that case. Other than that, we had peaceful and quiet nights at least.
Amazing place as a wedding with excellent service!
Very affordable accommodation and great service! Made my Wacky Wine extra special

As a wedding venue the overall experience was good not great.  Affordable rates. Great views, beautiful reception hall with plenty of potential for great Decor themes. Duvon should refine communication between venue and customer to enhance the overall experience. Exceptional customer service should be prioritised. More services and decor from DuVon should be added (obviously at an extra charge) to minimalise the DIY and outsourced supplier travel factor attached when renting the Venue. 
The food served was great (Lani's Kitchen).The self-catering guesthouse was lovely with good quality bedding, facilities as well as a spacious and warm ambiance. To summarise: if you love DIY and a more casual approach to service then this venue would be great.
Lovely place. The best service and extremely friendly staff. Wine tasting for free!!
Well balanced selection of wines that represents the spirit of the valley. Ask for the local (7yr) brandy which are only available at the cellar (if you are lucky). Friendly staff.
Friendly, helpful, professional and well educated staff.  Great experience!!  A definate stop in the future again!
Great experience. Welcoming staff.
I must admit I love the name! Magical area begging to be photographed,  lush grounds, beautiful people, and of course good wine. Very compatible with Napa wines where I live.

reviews.text: Very nice, quiet, boutique hotel. The winery is a bit smaller, but very pretty and has a gorgeous back drop. Because there are only a few rooms, staff is readily available and there are always seats at breakfast/dinner. A nice stop in wine country.

Clouds Estate was brilliant. The view was stunning across to the Franschhoek Valley. The service standard was high. The breakfast was good. I definitely recommend this hotel. Our room 10 was a 1 bedroom suite and cost R2.7k a night.

Wow, wow, wow... the view is beautiful, awe inspiring. From the patio of our unit 10, the paradise of a beautiful valley and glorious mountains rising precipitously into the heavens... wow a must stay for a romantic getaway.

Lovely spot to base yourself in the stellenbosch wine region. Excellent food and comfortable suites. Clouds is a small hotel that offers excellent value for money.

I would suggest diving next door one evening for dinner at Graff. Exceptional meal obviously at a premium price. 

Generous breakfast choices as well

All in all, are very happy with the place. I've rated it a4 star because on the three occasions I called 9 for assistance, the phone rang out!

The staff at the restaurant/tasting room were friendly and helpful. 
We loved the generous snack portions with the wine tasting and of course the exquisite view!

â€œGreat wines, great tasting experienceâ€

Four of us visited the winery on a rainy Saturday and Marezonne gave us a great tasting experience. We even had the chance to taste straight out of the barrels and what was supposed to be a 1-hour tasting ended up in a 3-hour tasting. Needless to say, we bought a lot of wine and looking forward to drinking it all! We also look forward to all the new events & activities that Marezonne is busy organising.

Visited August & October 2015
Very beautiful place to live with some beautiful views over the Onverwacht dam
Beautiful Homesteads and magical setting.

reviews.text: The highest winery on the hill in the region.  Good view all the way to the sea from the tasting room.  The road that leads to this vineyard is narrow but easy to follow.  The view of the vineyards on the slope is also beautiful with the mountain in the background.  I highly recommend you stop by here as a secondary destination of the region.

Still a great vineyard to go to with excellent views and great wine. Been here loads and bring all our tourist friends here. Sad the service was not the best as we came to expect from this great place. Will be back to see if the service improved as the wine is excellent
Had a lovely morning brunch with stunning view of entire False Bay area.  Definitely recommendable.  The wine is excellent too!
Lovely setting and fantastic views all the way back to the ocean. Wines were excellent and highly recommended.
truly stunning setting, totally unforgettable. The best vineyard we visited. Staff extremely knowledgeable and take time to explain and answer questions. Great disabled access.

reviews.text: Although the knowledgeable person/wine maker was not available on the day, the server on duty did her best with the wine tasing. Would like to have had the option to eat or snack on something. Overall good wines and an excellent cape ruby/port.
Awesome place, awesome wine!
Didn't try the reds but they have a nice lightly wooded Chardonnay. Great, friendly service too and a beautiful estate.
Really good cab

reviews.text: It was very good priced wih beautiful rooms and views, they also have a very nice pool for a hot summers day. It's perfect for a night stay or a few days xx

We arrived to find very neat and adequate accommodation, furnished in traditional woods such as oak and imbuia. Rooms were very neat and tidy, with all the amenities one could ask for and that includes air conditioning, over and above coffee and tea making facilities. 

The farmyard looks like a scene from.a fairy tale, with huge trees, greenest lawns, swallows flying about, guinea fowl and a wide range of flowers. A magic wonderland to city dwellers in postage stamp sized apartments. Here, we had space! 

Vineyards and Langeberg mountains. What impressed me was the absence of a troop of staff with fake smiles. We were welcomed by Alicia, who reminded us of tea or coffee yet brought us a complimentary bottle of award-winning 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon. 

We only ever had one complaint - that we couldn't stay on forever and a day!
Cos,it's surrounded by d Langeberge nd also are d spot for hiking

reviews.text: I decided to start drinking some wines from my red wine collection, and opened this beautiful bottle of 1981  Drostdy-Hof Waveren Vin Noir. Absolutely a beautiful wine - rich, peachy (!) tasting, with rich earthy smells and a delightful, almost almond after taste. Most incredible. I have to report that the cork was absolutely intact and still in good form! Great wine!
Very good. Thanks

reviews.text: This is a delightful little historical cottage.  A quiet and relaxing spot with beautiful views of the valley.  We really enjoyed the peaceful sounds of sheep grazing and the unbelievable stars at night.  The kitchen is very well stocked and the outside braai area is great for socialising around the fire.  We braved the outside shower (even though it was a chilly winter's morning) and the water was so hot that we easily survived (the not so brave can relax in the claw foot bathtub).   A lovely overnight venue and we'll be back for sure!

My guests I had from cape town room no 6 and I was no 11 both said never again. room 6 said in 15min she heard his whole life story...how he earns R4000 and  and and 22years in the business and a qualified chef please replace......you have such an amazing place would love to take it off your hands as clearly you employed him and you as an owner has no clue what you got......

reviews.text: The location and views are wonderful. Isaac our waiter was outstanding. The food was excellent,I loved ostrich the most. Liked the wines as well, especially Erasmus. We were served very fast and our order also arrived fast.

The food was good but was sadly contrasted by the long waiting time. For anything, such as wine glasses, ice, water for the table or drinks.

The waiters tended to watch their outside tables from the confines of the air conditioned inside section.

The view of the surrounding area was spectacular but again sorely contrasted by service.

In the future I will get a bottle of wine to enjoy a sunny day rather than risk spoiling it with at best average service.

Took clients there for an end of year function. 
It was extremely hot and we had to ask for a fan to be brought to our table to cool us down. Their excuse was that aircon couldn't cool the place down enough??
Service was not of the best as I had to call the waiter more than once.
Location though is stunning and if you looking for a place with a view, go there on a cool day
One of the best kept secrets of this valley.  Amazing place!  Our kids swim there while we have a nice drink or meal (Local Grill).  It also now has a Piza e Vino with a water park.  Awesome!

Awesome, amazing , beautiful place and the steaks at the local grill are fabulous. Quite frankly one of the best nights away and not all that
 far from Cape Town either, really well worth it to go for a night or two and just watch the sunset, enjoy a glass of wine followed by delicious food and finally an amazing night's rest, only to wake up and start the day all over again with a scrumptious breakfast  also included in the price . Great value for money and you feel as though you've been away for a week never mind just a night.

Newton Johnson was my favorite restaurant. However the I was a little dissapointed with my last visit. The waitres did explain that they are no longer offer fine dining. The first course was amazing however I was extremely dissapointed in the second course. My mother and sister had the fish corse. It was wonderful and looked great. I ordered the steak. I compared my food with the previous times I visited and honestly was so dissapointed I didn't even finish my meal. It was literally n piece of streak on a plate with chips and salad. I can go to any restaurant if I wanted that. It just looked like there was no effort put into it. The steak was dry event though I asked for medium rare. It is horrible for a restaurant that was in the top 10 restaurants in South-Africa not to long ago to be serving such dissapointing food

Side note; if you're a non smoker like us then hopefully nobody sat outside is smoking during your visit as it blows in through the windows and door to fill the small bar area.

reviews.text: Perfect place to have a lovely meal,  especially when you have children. Lovely lawn and play area for the kids. Well priced menu as well and the food is great. Service could be a little faster but overall a lovely morning spent here. Would be great if the children's "petting zoo" was more interactive, as an example if they could hold the bunnies.
Awesome venue well kept large open grounds for picnics. Kids will love it with animal farm and play gym enough to tire them out for the day
So many things to do here. Lovely restaurant and beautiful views. Staff are friendly and helpful. Great for the whole family.

Perfect place to take the family. The Cat Park is always interesting and educational for the kids, and with the large grounds and jungle gym the little critters are bound to stay entertained...while the adults can chillax at the restaurant keeping an eye on them.

Lovely venue for a peaceful and relaxed brunch/lunch picnic. The farm has some great views and the Hudson's where my partner and I had our picnic was nice. 

I was however disappointed by the lack of attention that we received. A week before I had made the booking to celebrate my partner's birthday. I asked for a complimenting wine to accommodate the picnic basket. Upon arrival the individual I had been in communication with from the Hudson's had been less helpful and accommodating as he was via email. 

When asked about which wine would be best, Matthew simply responded that it was the first he was hearing of my request. I wanted to make this special for my partner and it fell a little flat. As it was our first time on the wine farm, it felt as though we were not welcome to be in that space. 
I do wish to acknowledge that one waitress was kind enough to usher us out into the garden and offer her assistance should we require it. 

Although the establishment is lovely, it would be such an amazing experience if all members of staff paid attention to detail and address guests with respect and genuine interest. It is completely understandable that we are all human and some days we may not give our best - it is still important to acknowledge that working in a service providing industry where quality is essential, those who walk through your doors (regardless of who they are) wish to experience the same quality the establishment alludes to in its views, decor, overall aesthetic etc. 

More than that, the picnic basket was really worth it, the Sauvignon Blanc is absolutely stunning!!!

At that price you're expecting food that is cooked properly. We originally planned on eating dessert but didn't bother after the poor quality of the main. It's unfortunate as the venue is beautiful and the service was good.

reviews.text: Lovely venue.  Good food. Not cheap but good value for money.  Garden is lovely. The waitress who attended us at the time of our visit was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. I will go back. I recommend this restaurant.

The service was exceptional, very friendly and efficient. Hands down, the best steak I've ever had (wagyu). Starters were top class and the dessert hit the right spotðŸ‘ŒðŸ». Cannot wait to go back again. Thank you guys for an overall outstanding experience.

The following relays my experience at the somerset 96 Winery road restaurant. Fresh bread was served with olive oil as the only sauce, with no offer by the waiter of vinegar. I ordered the 250g beef "very cheesy" wagyu burger, and to say the least I was very disappointed. The burger was far too large to be able to enjoy one whole bite that would contain both the beef, the mushroom and cheese. As the bottom half the burger shrunk due to the inability to bite off a whole section of the burger and to avoiding a public scene of a gaping mouth with sauce covering my nose and face, the disappointing normalcy of the taste and flavors became even more evident. The beef patty could have been fried on oil in any kitchen, with no additional spices or sauces present. The mushroom always overwhelmed the halloumi cheese, and neither the cheddar not the mozzarella were distinguishable throughout the entire burger. Half way through the burger, the bun was falling apart and could no longer be held in one's hand. The fried chips were overdone and very bite was a constant reminder of how much oil was used frying the chips, and continuing to eat them became unbearable. For R135 - not to mention the R205 for a 500g portion which cannot be shared as stated in the menu (heaven help the person who ever tries to eat that a table among friends and family), there was absolutely nothing remarkable or cheesy about the "very cheesy" burger. 

Overall, I rated the restaurant 2/5, and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
Top class. One of the best steaks (Hollandaise Pepper) I've had. Kids (young teenagers) really enjoyed the play area. Sorbet to die for. Staff so friendly. Wonderful afternoon. Recommended.
Had the 6 course tasting menu which was extremely delicious and paired well with their house wines. The staff was professional and friendly. One of the best creme brulees I have tasted.

reviews.text:
Best views and good wine. The excellent tasty cheese platter complimented the wine. Was a bit noisy with the huge crowd, but the ambiance made up for the noise. The picnic area looks comfortable on the luscious grass; will try it out next time. You unfortunately have to book a picnic basket 24hours in advance. It seems to me the place is a favourite with the overseas travelers. The service was friendly, but a bit slow at times. 
To waive the wine tasting fee, you have spend R500 per person. Some wineries allowed a lower spending to waive the tasting fee.
None of the wines are under R100, but very very delicious

Beautiful views and stunning restaurant. Service here was really very good. Food was good but pricey, however that is expected when going to a fine dining establishment. Great for families as well with a big kids play area, lots of grass for picnic options and a small lake with deck. I would highly recommend Cape Point Vineyard Restaurant

We attended the night market and Christmas carols at Cape Point Vineyards, which is unexpectedly far from Cape Point! While the night market was packed with lovely local street food options, the bar was completely overpriced. CPV took full advantage of their monopoly by retailing their own wines at eye-watering prices. As a result we drank nothing and found that very disappointing. We would have liked to do wine tasting but it was closed due to the event. Their location is utterly lovely, with views of both sea and mountains, so its a real shame we couldn't make the most of it because they were being a bit greedy.

What a gorgeous setting! The view is wondrous! We were there from lunchtime through sunset until midnight. The views and surrounds throughout the day were astounding. The sunset was especially breathtaking. We took many pictures and each one is spectacular!

We visited on a Thursday when the markets were on. The atmosphere was great and watching the sun set is fantastic. Would recommend getting there early afternoon say 4pm as tables and grass area do fill up fast. Nice way to spend an afternoon watching the sun set. Cannot comment for other times when markets aren't on.

ChIJ4RIv5klqzB0RK47qApYWst8.vicinity: Silvermine Rd, Cape Point Vineyards Estate, Cape Town

reviews.text: The food and wine is good, the service too. Can be very busy at times. Good acoustics: you won't fight with the music, nor have to listen to other people's conversations. Cutlery and glassware good. I've been here 4 or 5 times, it's one of the better options in the Northern suburbs. I do think you can find a better dining experience and food elsewhere, for less money. Not my first choice.

Classy resturant with relaxed fine dining vibe. Food is really up there, wine list is not extensive but does have a reasonable selection. Considering it is located on a wine farm there are more than the house wines. Service was prompt. They not the cheapest that's for sure, but you get what you pay for. Great experience overall

The food was amazing! Presentation as well as taste. We ordered the mixed platter for two as well as an almond and blueberry dessert- apologies if the name isn't correct- menu needs to be updated on this app as it doesn't include the new desserts Cassia currently serve. 
It wasn't overly priced either considering the portion sizes, I was shocked with the size of the platter, and we nearly managed to finish all of it.

The completely original cocktails - I had the frozen Natida Martini and my mom had the frozen summer spice cocktail and the flavors were amazing.

I would've rated higher, however just battled to get attention from the service ambassadors (waiter).
Service was great.  Starter portion of mussels was yummy but pork  belly main was underwelming. The last time I was there the food disappointed as well.

I visit restaurants often, 2-3 times per week. I had a Red Latte that was excellent prepaired. Unfortunately I canâ€™t say the same about the filo cup filled with brie cheese and macadamia nuts. 
I could not cut the filo at all. After several attempts I ate the filling and left the cup. 
It seems like it was heated up in the microwave oven. 
It was not so much the bad filo pastry used but the attitude of both the waiter and chef. 
After reporting it to the chef the waiter came back with the answer - the chef said it was baked in the oven and he had no problem cutting it. 
And that was it. Honestly I was unable to cut it and there for uneatable. 
At least admit it when something is uneatable

ChIJewZ6FEFXzB0RVrxCwkNs_ts.vicinity: Tyger Valley Road, Durbanville, Cape Town

reviews.text: Lovely farm and beach riding place. The horses are well looked after. Kelly, the guide, was friendly and helpful. The surroundings are  beautifully tended and the small shops and restaurants around the farm have beautiful and often locally produced wares and food products of high quality that are not overpriced. The atmosphere is relaxed. The beach rides are magnificent.

We have been going here for years. It is a cool place for kids to play while we have bite. Great play area with a huge slide. I feel the animal area can do a whole lot more to enhance the experience for visitors. The coffee at the restaurant was also not that great.

Awesome entertainment for kids..petting & feeding of animals was fun! Maze POS device was offline, so need to go back & try that. The restaurant food was GOOD!!!..we had a few different starters, kids had hot chips & pizza. There's also a few lovely play areas for kids
Lovely casual place, especially with children. Friendly people, a lot of space and jungle gyms. Haven't tried the Maze yet. Next time.

reviews.text: Pure Nature - breath of fresh air- soal rewarding ðŸ¤—
It's so much fun, there is horse riding, wine estates and beautiful villas. My fav is horse riding though.

Had the pleasure of actually staying at the vineyard, and what an amazing place. Just beautiful. Beautiful views and beautiful people. The people working on this vineyard are so passionate about what they do. Had a tour around the vines and a private tasting. Would recommend Journeys End to anyone.

The Journey can't End soon enough for these horrible people!
          Have you ever made an appointment for a wine tasting well in advance, driven an hour to arrive at the winery right on time, only to be told by one of the owners upon arriving at the "tasting room" that, while they recalled making our appointment, no tasting was possible?  Hard to believe, right?   Well, that's exactly what happened to our party at Journey's End Vineyards.   There was no apology, no excuse given, but we were told that "we can sell you some wines if you want," as if anyone travels to a winery to buy wines they are unable to taste.   Why go to the winery at all? 
 	
          The wine business is tough enough without treating visitors in this fashion.  Oh, and if you aren't discouraged enough to avoid visiting this sorry place, be aware that unless you have an all terrain vehicle. your car will surely be damaged driving three kilometers over impossibly pot-holed unpaved dirt roads to arrive there.

          So one can only hope the despicable Gabb family that own this awful excuse for a winery exits the wine business promptly, that someone with an ounce of judgment and humanity takes over, paves the road leading to the winery, and then treats visitors as if they are actually happy to receive them.   Wouldn't that be a welcome development?

reviews.text: Terrible for the price. And just terrible in general. We booked in on 27 Dec, booked out 29 Dec and were charged R720 for breakfast on 3 Dec. We didnt even have breakfast at this place for the two nights we stayed there. How can you deduct money from someones card without their permission!? The TV is a joke. Its miniscule! DSTV was not working in one room at all (we didnt report it because it was late when we switched the tv on and we were irritated). There was a walkway between us and another room, we could still hear the people in that room talking and coughing. I know this because it was my mother in law in the other room. There is what I would assume is farm workers residence a few meters away. We could hear their music clearly, we could hear them drinking and talking and swearing until early hours of the morning. We could hear metal roof sheets moving in the wind and knocking. It was literally like sleeping outside. Iso board mounted directly to the roof is not an answer for a ceiling! Workmanship in the room was shoddy. Things falling off the walls, holes not filled up properly. Spider webs with spiders on the roof beams and ceiling. Nightmare!!!

reviews.text:
Hidden Gem as far as I am concerned.
I came across a Black Elephant MCC by chance in Joburg and am now swearing by it. Better than most champagne I say.
We took the opportunity to visit BEV during our last trip and loved the other wines and the conversation. If Google let me, I would give Black Elephant Vintners a 6th or 7th stars out of five.

If you only go to one vineyard this is the one. If you get fatigued by multiple wine tastings this is the one you will remember. 

Kevin has done something amazing at Black Elephant, great wine and great marketing add up to 3 here. 

I'm hooked - can't wait to get my hands on the next vintage of Amazing Grace.

Will

Really great experience, and the wines are focused on being easy drinking. The hosts are friendly and accommodating, where the music and wine experience is a great social experience. Not commercial or busy at all.

It's the 2nd wine tasting our wine club has had at Black Elephant and both were absolutely fantastic!  I just love their unpretentious yet knowledgable philosophy and of course their wines are also fantastic.  This time around we did the wine and music paring which was just so different and enjoyable.  My favourite winetasting experience EVER!  Thanks to all 3 of you and congratulations, just keep on doing what you're doing.  I'm sure you'll be seeing us again....
Enjoyed the toast and outside seating

This Estate is exceptionally groomed, what a gem!!!

reviews.text: The wine is simply out of this world. Definitely worth a dedicated trip

Our wine club had the absolute please to visit Keermont wines a week ago. The experience was 5 star! Juanita who conducted our tasting was knowledgeable, dupe organised and very professional. The venue was a delight and it was editing to walk the cellar with the stories of the wines and how intimate and loved it is. And the wine!! Terrasse ; there are few words to describe this wonderful and unusual blend. And that was just one! We loved every single one! The 8 club members all gave me stirling reviews - thank you!! Paired with de Trafford and lunch afterwards at Mont Marie will be one of your best days ever!

reviews.text: Just moved in, at this stunning estate. The security guards are very friendly and close the big gates to the estate before sunset for extra security (only access is my member card or buzzer for security). The vineyard inside is both beautiful, calming and creates a big divide in seeing all the other houses. Speed limit of 35kmh and curfew everyday at 8pm, makes it children friendly, quiet and relaxing. The only internet available is ADSL up to 20Mbps.
Still new with linited trees, upmarket security village.
Beautiful views of both the back of table mountain in the distance and the Drakenstein mountains. In a housing estate, meaning you get to know some of the locals.
Beautiful Vineyard Estate. Live on a working wine farm. Lovely wine. Has won some awards.
Beautiful Estate with vineyards surrounding houses. Clubhouse with a gym and conference room. Wine is notably good (some of it is great, some not as great) - dams and playgrounds for the kids.

The owner, Jacques Borman, popped in to greet us and even took out one of his private collections (The Conclusion, which is sold out) to taste and he even sold some of his bottles to us. He was also kind enough to sign my bottles! Scenic views and friendly people. If we didn't have other appointments we would have spent the entire day there! This farm will become my compulsory stop during every trip to Stellenbosch.

reviews.text: Rust en vrede is a wonderful estate at the very end of a valley. The view from the terrace is splendid and the tasting "menus" are absolutely worth their price. It is of course possible to eat there (often without a reservation for lunch). The wines are delicious and worth every penny. The tastings are free if you buy bottles.
The lunch Menu in the wine tasting room is perfect and not too  expensive. The wine was great ! If in Stellenbosch Worth visiting !
Absolutely fantastic. Really recommend this place for a glass of wine and looking at one of the finest wine states around.
Great wine and food! Beautiful scenery too. Chef Fabio is great!

This is a lovely restaurant in a great setting. We did the set menu and wine pairing - thinking it would be like London we expected to be in and out in about 2.5 hours - we started our meal at 7 and left the restaurant just after 11. They really do take their time between courses!

5 of the 6 courses were incredible, however the chef had a cheese soufflÃ© for the 5th course which was probably the worst course i have had in any restaurant....ever. It was more like a very salty scrambled egg cake. It wasn't just a one off as it appeared to be a common complaint. 

It was also my fiancÃ©'s birthday. I had notified them 3 times before arriving and not once did they wish her happy birthday.

The biggest issue however which stopped this from being a 5/5 was that they didn't have enough of their own wines on their menu. first and foremost this is a vineyard - perhaps they should design a menu around their excellent stand out wines (for mains to desserts as they only produce full bodied red wines) and not the other way around!

Kids loved the playground and I think we were the last to leave, apart from the friendly staff who made sure we had everything we needed all evening. Thank you! We'll be back!
Great resturaunt and setting with friendly service and awesome craft beers and craft gins . 100% worth a visit

reviews.text: I was a guest at a family member's wedding on 21 November 2015. A young girl accidentally ran into the glass sliding door. The entire glass in the door cracked in lines. The child fortunately only got minor scratches. The scary part of the accident was that the door did not have safety/shatterproof glass. So as far as I am concerned the minimum safety requirements were not met by the establishment at all. If the child broke the glass which was highly possible, she would have sustained very serious injuries. To crown this all, the owners of the venue insisted that the family pay for the replacement of the glass. I am definitely not recommending this venue to anyone.

reviews.text: Did the tea and chocolate tasting and it was a wonderful alternative to sitting in a restaurant and drinking a pot of tea. The combinations of chocolate and gourmet tea really was delicious.

I often visit with tourists from all over the world and a common remark from them is, "That was the best presented wine tasting we have had anywhere in the world" Not to mention that the KWV is iconic in the South African wine industry and that they have a tremendous variety of quality products.
I loved the selection of wine tasting/pairing options.
Their service is great and the tastings excellent
Very nice .

reviews.text: I'm so glad I discovered this vineyard.  Had a lovely time there.  The food was good and the service was excellent.  Everyone so friendly.  Also the wine is spectacular!  Well worth a visit.  I will be back :)

What a pleasant surprise to find this boutique winery and home of the world's only white Pinotage!

Great people, a hands-on team, shared with is their history and wines, which includes an excellent Viognier and Tempranillo, apart from their signature Pinotage.

Well worth a visit!

......our first encounter with this establishment was already a foretaste of good things to expect! At the end of September we had emailed them to book our reservation with the intention of visiting on the 15th Oct. 2017 we were blown away that the very same afternoon we had a reply from Tessa confirming our reservation! Wow! Very impressive! As the time came nearer we discovered that we had a more important engagement on the 15th Oct. so we phoned to ask if we can alter our reservation to a week before again we had the opportunity to speak to Tessa who was most obliging to make our visit possible for Lunch time on the 8th Oct. and guess what? Tessa happened to be our host so we met her in person which turned out to be absolute-lii magnificent as Tessa turned out to be an outstanding host, very knowledgeable with every detail of every wine she poured  us to taste! We had come to experience a Sunday Lunch with a difference, Wine tasting 3 white's Seraphic, White Pinotage, Chardonnay & 3 red's Rose', Shiraz, Revelation plus a Platter with cured meats, cheeses, olives & breads and oh yes Chocolate brownies! It was delightful-ii delicious and very filling! The only let down was that there coffee machine was out of order as we real-lii needed to have an espresso after all the wines but that wasn't to serious we knew that the Wine-lands Engen was on the way back to Cape Town were we could and did stop to have that coffee! This venue is set in a Picturesque wine yard with beautiful gardens filled with large oak trees and lots of green grass! The reception area is very well decorated in a real winery way, although the tasting room is rather small but very cos-ii with a pleasant fire-place and seen that it was a bit chillii today they had a log-fire going filling the room with a very romantic ambiance! This place comes very high-lii recommended by us and it's worth a visit some or other time from all wine lovers!................its our opinion that this venue will do well if they have a full on restaurant as you are unable to order a more solid meal but we are told that they are working towards this for the future!............Clap! Clap! Clap!....
Great wine, great venue, great service. A gem worth a visit!
Cosy, scenic, historic feel. Great platters and, of course, wine.

reviews.text: Great Place to be. I have only visited and do not live there, but from what I have seen it is amazing.
One of the best places that I have visited  in capetown  so far,advanced  security  at every point very secured  complex in capetown
Lovely, nice people, great sights for tourist and general good vibes from the estate ðŸ‘Œ
Upmarket security village. Great collection of people living in fear.
Breathtaking views, gorgeous homes. A true super-estate with the best golfing greens, polo fields and now a 42km cycling trail.
Awesome experience on our doorstep. Getting the opportunity to hold a baby croc well worth it. Recommended as a family outing, on site restaurant as well. And some snakes to see as well.
Very nice views and facilities. Great place to bring young kids but is also beneficial for teens!
Beautiful, peaceful place. Very informative and interesting if you take a tour. Kids loved it as well.
Cool place especially for kids as there's a playground area to keep them entertained - Crocodile talk and tour very educational - nice tranquil afternoon spent :)

Very nice venue! 
The crocodile show and snake shows are awesome!

But the restaurant is very bad. The food took ages to arrive. I mean how long should it take to arrange cheeses on a plate? And they were not even that busy. My friends' food arrived cold as well.

Conclusion: I'd go back to see the animals but not their culinary talents ;)

reviews.text: Lekker, friendly place with great meals, musoc and micro brewed beer, only need a great local craft beer like Bergrivier or CBC.
Ok for a quick meal, prices reasonable.

Visited it last night 25/02/17. Nice place, nice vibe, good food but...just a few hiccups i want to point out. First the arrival, the person i assume the manager stood at the door to welcome patrons. Yet no smile, rather a face that said " I hope they are not coming in." Second the waiter got our orders wrong not once but twice and the wait wow, they really take there time in the kitchen but one would expect to wait really long if the place was packed except it wasn't. Third We sat a corner booth next the door leading to the smoking area. Which was a bit of a itch as people were moving in an out and not always closing the door behind them. Next to us was a reserved booth that we switched to but wasn't marked as reserved and we were politely told about its unavailability. Something that could have been avoided if a clear sign was on the table and not just a erected menu. Yet i may visit again maybe try a different table and hopefully get an attentive waiter and be welcomed with a inviting smile as one would expect on arrival
Check your take away orders.. lots of fiod missing. Portions got smaller while price got increased.

The food was out of this world. I ordered Prawn curry and its few restaurants that are able to make a delicious curry. The portions are enough for two people. The waitress Chante was very friendly and helpful. I had a craving for curry when I came there and left with an even bigger craving. Your food was just WOW WOW WOW!I hope the other branches follow your example. I would hope to visit again soon. Thank you for the wonderful warm experience on a cold wet night.

reviews.text: There's an art gallery with sculptures outside. Every minute is  worth it

We had a very pleasant lunch at Cafe Bon Bon. The setting is stunning and the service impeccable from Akona. Management is hands on and attentive. No blaring music. Very civilized.

We had the salmon and duck starters, the sea bass and nectarine and rhubarb deserts. All were delicious although the fish, though perfectly cooked, was a bit bland and needed more seasoning. Perhaps some lemon would have helped?  

The owner is a decorator and it shows everywhere. Just love the attention to detail. Was also impressed by the size of Hendrik (see picture).

The prices are slightly high, but the quality of the food and the generous portion sizes more than makes up for it. 

An excellent find. In the words of the great former governor of California: "I will be back".

This place is like a heavenly oasis and so beautifully well kept. Cafe Bon Bon food and service were first class, even though we were late. Thank you for welcoming dogs as well. We will definately be back and want to try stay over too. Amazing place!

CafÃ© Bon Bon held the last roaring flames on our Fireplaces in Franschhoek Media Trip and was a fitting ending to a rather delightful trip. Inviting fireplace in Cafe Bon Bon. Before we hit the road back to Cape Town, we were treated to breakfast at the stylish CafÃ© Bon Bon on La Petite Dauphine Estate {READ MORE ON MY BLOG - www.thejaxblog.com/cafe-bon-bon-la-petite-dauphine/ )
A most beautiful place for lunch with family and friends. The view, food just simply amazing! Thank you for that experience and you will see us again, again and AGAIN ðŸ˜Š

reviews.text:
We stayed for two nights at the Leeulaagte Cottages with our two four legged kids.

We had a SUPER time, slept well on very comfortable beds and enjoyed the peace and quiet.

The Cottage is roomy,the kitchen has everything one need and we loved sitting on the porch in the evening.

The swimming pool was literally a life saver in the January heat wave!

Location is superb, well away to have privacy and quietness, yet close enough to Durbanville for all the restaurants and other amenities one should want.

We will in future stay with you guys again.

Special word of thanks to Richard for ALWAYS responding to e-mails, and the troubles he took to forward an item I, due to my own negligence, left behind.

Best Wishes,

Izak and Elmarie van Rooyen.

PS. I also do hope you guys get a lot of good rain very soon!
Lovely staff would definitely recommend! Peaceful and a home away from home.
Amazing self-catering cottages in a rural environment. Neat, clean and spacious
Very windy okish toilets are small. Not mych to look at tho.

Absolutely amazing!!! Our wedding was AWESOME!!!! Thank you Jo for all your assistance and for wise words of knowledge. We have passed out in an amazing cottage that was perfectly looked after and in immaculate condition.
